issueDTO.title: Convert the onboarding section to RST
issueDTO.description:
We are in the process of moving this repository to Read the Docs, and to do that we need to convert our pages from Markdown to RST. This issue is to transfer the Onboarding section: [https://contribute.mautic.org/on-boarding](https://contribute.mautic.org/on-boarding). You can also update and improve the content on these pages if you like - do check with the team leads first to ensure it's relevant.

You can do this in the current repo, as we've got a folder set up, `/docs`, which will be used for Read The Docs.

You can build this documentation locally by cloning this repository, and following these steps: https://github.com/mautic/user-documentation/tree/5.x?tab=readme-ov-file#build-documentation-locally. Change into the /docs folder and then (assuming you have DDEV and Docker/Colima installed) type `ddev config` and select `build/html `as the root folder when configuring DDEV. Then when complete, type `ddev start` and it'll give you the link to your local testing environment.

If you need to make a link file to add an external URL, please use the command line tool 'make link'. This will generate a reference macro and a link file for you.

For internal linking check the docs on using the [:ref: role](https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/guides/cross-referencing-with-sphinx.html#the-ref-role) for linking within the same document, and using [:doc: to link across pages](https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/guides/cross-referencing-with-sphinx.html#the-doc-role).

**Please note: if you see folders called .revs these are old version control files from Grav. Ignore them! (they should be deleted) and instead work on the actual files.**

When you've converted the file/s, **they need to live within the /docs folder**. We can create a structure using sub-folders to organise the sections. You also need to add the pages to the Table of Contents in the index.rst file for them to show on the menu. Docs on the ToC can be found [here](https://sublime-and-sphinx-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/indices.html).
We highly recommend that you use VS Code with Vale installed. Let us know if you have any problems.

Some useful resources: 
- https://sublime-and-sphinx-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest guide to Sphinx/RST formatting
- https://sublime-and-sphinx-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/references.html#use-the-external-links-extension how to do external links - always check the /docs/links directory first! You can use the terminal command '`make link`' to create the link file automagically.

There are many MD to RST tools out there which can help speed up the process, however you will still need to review your output to ensure it passes our Vale grammar rules. Headings must always be unique, as well.

We use the following for headings:

```
H1 ###
H2 ***
H3 ===
H4 ---
H5 ~~~
```

Please ask in #t-education on Slack if you get stuck with anything!
comments: I'd like to take on the task of converting the onboarding section to RST. I believe my understanding of the project's structure and familiarity with RST make me a good fit for this task. Kindly assign me this issue under Hacktoberfest 2024 so I can contribute to the project and fulfill my Hacktoberfest requirement.
Thanks for the enthusiastic responses @HappySR ! As we have a lot of interested contributors, I'll open up this PR for others, until you've completed #224.
Hey @RCheesley , I'd like to help with this.

issueDTO.title: Document setting up IDE integration with BlocksDS
issueDTO.description:
From a certain forum:

> The problem is that outside of setup there is no documentation/tutorial at all for integrating BlocksDS support into an IDE, whether it its VS Code, the full fat VS or any other C/C++ IDE available out there. Has anyone tried so far to include BlocksDS functions inside an IDE and compile a program with it in a terminal? I am sorry if this topic exists already.

Wonderful solves this by providing some tools and some patches on top of GCC to generate `compile_commands.json` files that most IDEs can ingest, however this will further deepen BlocksDS's dependency on Wonderful. There are probably other options.
comments:
As a quick and dirty solution, it may be worth documenting clangd's compile_flags.txt which can specify options (defines, include paths, target...) across an entire project. It's quite easy to set up and I use it myself in most C and C++ projects I work with--although I don't believe it would work for arm7+arm9 projects given that the options are project-wide. I'm not sure what behavior clangd follows if there are different compile_flags.txt in subdirectories, but that could be a possible solution.

There's also the possibility of making a tool that generates compile_commands.json by traversing the specified source directories and creating entries with the proper arm7/arm9 flags, although something like [bear](https://github.com/rizsotto/Bear) could just be used instead (I've found it to be a bit finicky though).
Personally, I just went for implementing `-MJ` in GCC; it's convenient but, again, this makes it incompatible with non-Wonderful toolchains, as it's a non-upstreamed patch.

repository.name: sdk

issueDTO.title: Exposing a value to the graph should add and connect up an equivalent value node
issueDTO.description:
Related: https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/issues/2567

If you click the dot to expose an input to the graph...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8a44a7b9-990f-481c-945f-341969fcf14c)

(here, the top one is exposed and the other two are not)

...it removes the control from the Properties panel and puts a connector on the node in the graph.

But that connector starts out connected to nothing. And whatever value the user had typed in the Properties panel previously, isn't represented anymore.

We want to have the process of clicking to expose an input to create a value node in the graph which is set to the same value as the Properties panel had. (This will require the creation of new value nodes, since not all representable Properties panel types have a value node yet.)

As a stretch goal, we also would like the reverse to occur: if a user un-exposes a node, it should evaluate what its current value is and set that to the input in the Properties panel. Perhaps only optionally, though, because the current behavior might be desired some (most?) of the time. This aspect can wait to be figured out or we can break it out into a separate issue.
comments: Hello @Keavon , https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/issues/2434 already has a PR to it , May I work on this issue ?
Sure, you're welcome to begin with this issue.

> And whatever value the user had typed in the Properties panel previously, isn't represented anymore

This is not correct. Exposing the input simply changes the front end display. It does not change the value stored for the input

> We want to have the process of clicking to expose an input to create a value node in the graph which is set to the same value as the Properties panel had

Value nodes don't really exist. Values are stored in the input, and the identity node is a universal value node which allows the input to be connected to many nodes. It simply needs to display its name based on the type

repository.description: An open source graphics editor for 2025: comprehensive 2D content creation tool suite for graphic design, digital art, and interactive real-time motion graphics — featuring node-based procedural editing
repository.name: Graphite

summary.main: When clicking the dot to expose an input to the graph, the control should be removed from the Properties panel and a connector should be added to the node in the graph. The value of the Properties panel should be represented in the new value node in the graph.
summary.validationOrRequirement: When exposing a value to the graph, it should add and connect an equivalent value node.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue requires the creation of new value nodes in the graph, as not all representable Properties panel types have a value node yet.
summary.otherNotes: Related issue: https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/issues/2567

issueDTO.title: Correct behaviour of Copy-Constructors
issueDTO.description:
Follow-Up to #893 

## Description

Copy-Constructors are supposed to create a copy of a given value - by value, not reference.
This is done by constructing a new value for the constructors type by _copying_ all fields from the old value to the one to be constructed.

Throughout the code-base this is currently flawed:
- Some Copy-Constructors miss required fields
- Some Copy-Constructors copy by reference, not value

## Definition of Done

- [ ] Checked for all occurences of Copy-Constructors
- [ ] Adjusted all Copy-Constructors such that **all** _required_ fields (no persistence-ids e.g.) are copied by value
comments:
Hi! I'd like to help with this issue.
I’ve read through the original issue #893 and understand that the goal is to ensure that copy constructors (e.g., in classes like TaskCommentImpl, ObjectReferenceImpl, etc.) copy all relevant fields by value and not reference — and omit persistence-related IDs where needed.

Would it be okay if I take on this task? I’ll start by reviewing all *Impl entity classes and correcting the constructors where necessary.

summary.attemptedFixes: The issue description does not mention any specific attempted fixes, but the commenter is willing to take on the task and start reviewing all *Impl entity classes and correcting the constructors where necessary.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is a follow-up to #893 and aims to ensure that copy constructors in the codebase correctly copy all required fields by value and not reference, omitting persistence-related IDs where necessary.

issueDTO.title: Remove dead code
issueDTO.description:
### Requirement

Remove dead code from the repository

### Proposal

Use official `deadcode` tool to identify unused code https://mfbmina.dev/en/posts/golang-deadcode/. It currently lists quite a few functions and packages.

### Recommended process

1. Run deadcode tool and pick ONE package to focus on.
2. Post a comment to this issue stating which package you're working on
3. Do not just delete the package / function, do some research first
   * find where (which PR) the function was introduced and what was using it & why
   * ideally find the PR in which that usage was removed without removing the function itself
   * post your findings in the comments to validate with maintainers that it's ok to delete
comments:
Hi @yurishkuro,

i have started with identification of unreachable functions with deadcode.
i am working on **cmd/ingester/** module and found out some deadcode but facing issues in pin pointing the related commit and PR.

Any help will be greatly appreciated.

Thanks!!

You can use git blame to show commits for specific lines, or git log to show history of the whole file. Sometimes files get moved so you may need to follow those moves. Once you have an interesting commit use git show to see more details and the pr number usually will be in the commit message.

Thanks,

Sure, I will leverage the information for further investigation.

Hi @yurishkuro 
I have been examining the `examples` package and found a function that is not in use https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/blob/cc7ea8d7fd5403c78e0a23db5c6bf06188c32546/examples/hotrod/pkg/pool/pool.go#L41

It was in introduced in pr [#40](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pull/40)
and was latest updated in pr [#1454](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pull/1454)

I am not able to find or get a clear indication where in the current codebase it was being used.

@AnmolxSingh this is because HotROD does not implement proper shutdown sequence, which should be invoked when the program receives a kill signal (other Jaeger binaries do trap the signal and perform shutdown)

Hi @yurishkuro 
while examining the `internal` package I found a function which might be a example of dead code.
https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/blob/f887e133cce1ffcbb4015868025f6bfd4c035764/internal/testutils/logger.go#L90

Just wanted to know is here to serve some purpose?
Introduced in pr [#198](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pull/198)

@AnmolxSingh I'd expect this function to be required by the API in the logging library. It doesn't mean our code would be invoking it directly. How else would the data be written to the buffer by the logging library?

Hi @yurishkuro,

While examining the codebase, I found that most of the functions identified as unused (dead code) are either:

- Used in `*_test.go` files, or
- Auto-generated by `thrift-0.9.2`.

Aside from those cases and the functions we've already discussed, I didn’t find any other obvious unused functions.

and the last PR i could find where major changes were made to this file is #6567, [here](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/commit/d7ab0f8c175956c1d36bbc2e18b34469f568e205#diff-8f0bb159e943f0e3d69c11c0f8a6f9d7ac80d647fba0ed66b7132587a3664d93R452)

Thank you.

issueDTO.title: Port crash commands to drgn
issueDTO.description:
# Background

[crash](https://crash-utility.github.io/)'s command-oriented interface, while less flexible than drgn, has some distinct advantages:

* For common operations, it is much more terse.
* Many kernel developers are already comfortable with it.

There have also been requests for a crash-to-drgn translation guide. As a response, we are porting crash commands to drgn, adding a `--drgn` option to onboard users to drgn's more advanced functionality.

# Contributing

The porting process is being tracked in https://github.com/users/osandov/projects/2. If you would like to work on a command, comment here (or reach out to @osandov) and we will create a new issue to track that command. Commands with many options can be split up further.

Currently, this work is in the `commands` branch, which is still a work in progress and will be rebased often. It will eventually be merged into the `main` branch.

# Guidelines

* The output format and behavior of each crash command should be recreated relatively closely in order to prioritize onboarding for crash users. However, we can deviate from crash if needed.
* New functionality should be added as drgn helpers as much as possible. Ideally, commands should mainly call helpers and format output.
* Every command should have a `--drgn` option that prints how to do the equivalent operation using drgn APIs.
* Commands should be added to modules under `drgn/commands/_builtin/crash`. Feel free to create a new module if appropriate.
* Test cases should be added under `tests/linux_kernel/crash_commands` for every command. Since most functionality should be in helpers with thorough unit tests, test cases for commands can be basic smoke tests.

See `_crash_cmd_mount()` in `drgn/commands/crash/_builtin/fs.py` and `TestMount` in `tests/linux_kernel/crash_commands/test_fs.py` for examples.

issueDTO.title: OpenAI Provider Integration
issueDTO.description:
**1. Overview:**

Ensure robust and up-to-date integration of the OpenAI API as a core LLM provider within the `voltagent` framework, utilizing the official `openai` Node.js SDK. This involves verifying support for the latest OpenAI models (GPT-4, GPT-3.5 variants), features (like tool calling, JSON mode), and ensuring the implementation aligns perfectly with the `LLMProvider` interface and `voltagent` conventions.

**2. Goals:**

*   Implement or verify a dedicated `OpenAIProvider` class adhering to the `LLMProvider` interface.
*   Support core generation functionalities (`generateText`, `streamText`, `generateObject`, `streamObject`) using OpenAI models.
*   Utilize the latest official `openai` Node.js SDK.
*   Correctly map `voltagent` generation options (model, temperature, max tokens, tool choice, etc.) to OpenAI API parameters.
*   Implement robust support for OpenAI's tool calling mechanism, mapping seamlessly to `voltagent`'s tool definition and execution flow.
*   Support OpenAI's JSON mode for reliable structured output generation (`generateObject`/`streamObject`).
*   Handle authentication using OpenAI API keys.
*   Integrate OpenAI-specific error handling and response parsing.

**3. Proposed Architecture & Components:**

*   **`OpenAIProvider`:** A class (potentially existing but needing review/update) within `agent/providers` implementing `LLMProvider`. It should:
    *   Use the official `openai` Node.js library.
    *   Handle API client initialization (API key, potentially base URL for proxies).
    *   Implement `generateText`, `streamText`, `generateObject`, `streamObject`, correctly formatting requests (messages, tools, model parameters) and parsing responses/streams.
    *   Specifically handle the `tool_calls` and `tool_results` message flow for tool usage.
*   **Provider Registration:** Ensure `OpenAIProvider` is correctly registered and selectable.
*   **Configuration:** Allow users to select 'openai' as the provider, specify models (e.g., 'gpt-4-turbo', 'gpt-3.5-turbo'), and provide API keys.
*   **Tool Mapping:** Refine the logic that translates `voltagent` tool definitions into the format expected by the OpenAI API's `tools` parameter and processes `tool_calls` responses.

**4. Affected Core Modules:**

*   `agent/providers`: `OpenAIProvider` class implementation/refinement.
*   `agent/types`: Ensure types accurately reflect OpenAI's request/response structures, especially for tools.
*   `ToolManager`: Interaction with `OpenAIProvider` for formatting tool definitions and handling tool calls.
*   `Agent`/`Agent Options`: Configuration for provider selection, models, and credentials.
*   Requires the `openai` dependency.

**5. Acceptance Criteria (Initial MVP / Refinement):**

*   Users can configure an `Agent` to use `OpenAIProvider` with various GPT models (e.g., GPT-4 Turbo, GPT-3.5 Turbo) and an API key.
*   `agent.generateText()` and `agent.streamText()` work correctly.
*   `agent.generateObject()` and `agent.streamObject()` utilize OpenAI's JSON mode successfully.
*   Agents can reliably use tools defined in `voltagent`, with requests and responses correctly handled via the OpenAI tool calling API.
*   Relevant options (temperature, max tokens, tool choice) are passed correctly.
*   Integration uses the current version of the official `openai` SDK.
*   Documentation reflects the updated/verified OpenAI integration details.

**6. Potential Challenges & Considerations:**

*   Keeping up with frequent updates and changes in the OpenAI API and SDK.
*   Ensuring the tool calling implementation is robust and handles various edge cases (multiple tool calls, errors).
*   Mapping `voltagent`'s internal state/history accurately to the sequence of messages expected by OpenAI, especially when including tool results.
*   Handling differences in behavior or features across different OpenAI models.
*   Cost management and monitoring token usage for OpenAI API calls.

issueDTO.title: Incorrect projection pushdown for document based File Connector
issueDTO.description:
## Describe the bug
When using file connector locally, when a user asks for a projection with a single column, it will incorrectly only return the `location` column (i.e. the first column) regardless of what is specified.

## To Reproduce
```shell
sql> select location from docs;
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| location                                                                           |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Users/jeadie/Github/spiceai/docs/decisions/001-use-snmalloc-as-global-allocator.md |
| Users/jeadie/Github/spiceai/docs/decisions/003-duration-ms.md                      |
| Users/jeadie/Github/spiceai/docs/decisions/002-default-ports.md                    |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

sql> select content from docs; # returning location, not content
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| content                                                                            |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Users/jeadie/Github/spiceai/docs/decisions/001-use-snmalloc-as-global-allocator.md |
| Users/jeadie/Github/spiceai/docs/decisions/003-duration-ms.md                      |
| Users/jeadie/Github/spiceai/docs/decisions/002-default-ports.md                    |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

sql> select length(content), location from docs; # When both are in projection, content is returned (and used) correctly.
+--------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| character_length(docs.content) | location                                                                           |
+--------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 3025                           | Users/jeadie/Github/spiceai/docs/decisions/003-duration-ms.md                      |
| 2443                           | Users/jeadie/Github/spiceai/docs/decisions/001-use-snmalloc-as-global-allocator.md |
| 3579                           | Users/jeadie/Github/spiceai/docs/decisions/002-default-ports.md                    |
+--------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
```

## Runtime Details
Happens on latest build and prior releases.

### Spicepod
Can use `docs/` from this repo to reproduce.

```yaml
datasets:
  - from: file:docs/decisions/
    name: docs
    params:
      file_format: md
```

## Additional context
 - Does not occur for structured files (e.g. CSVs). 
 - Code related to document object store tables is [here](https://github.com/spiceai/spiceai/blob/trunk/crates/data_components/src/object/text.rs).

issueDTO.title: Add blob splitting and joining to TxClient
issueDTO.description:
Many use cases need the ability to split up a large blob into sub blobs, submit them, retrieve them and reconstruct the original blob.

We should add that ability into TxClient
comments:
Hi @evan-forbes I am intrigued by this issue and I would be willing to take a stab at it.

I was wondering: 

What is the expected behaviour if one of more chunks fail submission?

> What is the expected behaviour if one of more chunks fail submission?

we should likely retry, however it depends on the reasoning for the failure. For instance if the network is congested and the tx was evicted, then we likely just need to retry and continue to use the fee estimator to get a more up to date fee. If our account is out of funds to pay for gas however, retrying isn't going to do anything and we should return to the user. 

I'm not sure tbh how the TxClient handles this as is, but ideally we should reuse that logic as much as possible. Meaning, if we can treat each chunk in a similar way to a single chunk, and retry/return to the user in the same ways, that seems like a great start.

> we should likely retry, however it depends on the reasoning for the failure. For instance if the network is congested and the tx was evicted, then we likely just need to retry and continue to use the fee estimator to get a more up to date fee. If our account is out of funds to pay for gas however, retrying isn't going to do anything and we should return to the user.

Gotcha. I'll try to make sure the code is adaptable in that regard.

Stupid question: Is the scope of this issue limited to adding the split/join or is it expected to have end-to-end code-completeness integrated in the current API?

> Is the scope of this issue limited to adding the split/join or is it expected to have end-to-end code-completeness integrated in the current API?

not 100% sure what is meant by e2e completeness, but in general we can't add a buggy feature unless we know we can follow up before the next release

Sorry, I didn't explain myself correctly.

I mean: is the scope of this issue just to add blob splitting / joining logic (with tests, to be integrated in a subsequent incremental PR) or also to integrate these with the current submission and retrieval of blobs so that splitting and joining is performed automatically under the hood?

I am happy either way, I am asking to make sure we are all on the same page with the scope and blast radius of the changes.

>   integrate these with the current submission and retrieval of blobs so that splitting and joining is performed automatically under the hood?

ahh I see, for this we want a separate entry point. Users need to specifically opt into using the splitting for now as that is signing and submitting multiple txs. Presumably it would do so using existing submission logic.

fwiw, we just started work on the TxClient to improve handling failures, so we don't need to write any additional failure handling logic with splitting.

issueDTO.title: After installing latest tag v0.3 final reports are not available
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
After installation and executing a first verification, we can see that report are not available, specially when we should go to emba_logs
Even thought they are available inside the server, they are not available via the web-browser. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. EMBArk installation (default mode/docker-mode)
2. Start EMBArk: sudo ./run-server.sh
3. Run analysis
4. Try to read logs
5. See error

_Not Found
The requested resource was not found on this server._

**Expected behavior**
Open reports
comments:
Thank you for contributing an issue!

**Welcome to the EMBA firmware analysis community!**

We are glad you are here and appreciate your contribution. Please keep in mind our contributing guidelines [here](https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [here](https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark/blob/master/CONTRIBUTORS.md).
Also, please check [existing open issues](https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark/issues) and consider to open a discussion in the dedicated [discussion area](https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark/discussions).
Additionally, we have collected a lot of details around EMBArk, the installation and the usage of EMBArk in our [Wiki](https://github.com/e-m-b-a/embark/wiki).

If you like _EMBA_ you have the chance to support us by becoming a [Sponsor](https://github.com/sponsors/e-m-b-a) or buying some beer [here](https://www.buymeacoffee.com/securefirmware).

issueDTO.title: [Feature Request]: Configurable Connection Retries for DB and Redis
issueDTO.description:
### 🧭 Epic

**Title:** Configurable Connection-Retry Back-off for Database & Redis  
**Goal:** Prevent gateway startup failures caused by slow-to-start services by making retry limits and intervals fully configurable. 
**Why now:** In containerised deployments Postgres (or any other SQL backend) and Redis often take several seconds to accept TCP connections. Today the gateway gives up on the first failure, crashing with `psycopg2.OperationalError: connection … refused`. Operators need a simple way—via environment variables, just like `DB_POOL_SIZE`, `CACHE_TYPE`, etc.—to tune how many times and how often the gateway retries before aborting.

---

### 🧭 Type of Feature

- [x] Enhancement to existing functionality

---

### 🙋‍♂️ User Story 1

**As a:** DevOps engineer running MCP Gateway in Kubernetes  
**I want:** to set `DB_MAX_RETRIES` and `DB_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS` for any SQLAlchemy-backed database  
**So that:** the application patiently waits until the database container is ready, instead of crashing and restarting in a loop

#### ✅ Acceptance Criteria

```gherkin
Scenario: Database retries during startup
Given MCP Gateway starts with DB_MAX_RETRIES=10 and DB_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS=5000
And the database is not yet ready
When the first connection attempt fails
Then the gateway should log "DB connection failed (attempt 1/10), retrying in 5 s"
And it should retry every 5 s
And after 10 failed attempts it should exit with a clear error message
```

---

### 🙋‍♂️ User Story 2

**As a:** Site Reliability Engineer using Redis caching  
**I want:** analogous knobs `REDIS_MAX_RETRIES` and `REDIS_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS`  
**So that:** the gateway’s cache layer behaves consistently with the database layer

#### ✅ Acceptance Criteria

```gherkin
Scenario: Redis retries respect custom settings
Given REDIS_MAX_RETRIES=15 and REDIS_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS=2000
And Redis is unavailable
When the cache subsystem initialises
Then it must retry up to 15 times at 2 s intervals
And surface a single aggregated error if all attempts fail
```

---

### 🙋‍♂️ User Story 3

**As a:** Platform administrator  
**I want:** sensible defaults (3 retries × 2000 ms) so I don’t have to set anything for typical installs  
**So that:** small deployments gain resilience out-of-the-box

#### ✅ Acceptance Criteria

```

Scenario: Defaults work when variables are unset
Given none of the four *_RETRIES or *_INTERVAL_MS variables are set
When the gateway cannot reach the database
Then it retries 3 times with 2 s between attempts

```

---

### 📐 Design Sketch (optional)

```mermaid
flowchart TD
subgraph Settings
ENV[".env / ENV vars"]
end
ENV --> Config[config.py load Settings]
Config -->|DB config| DBClient[SQLAlchemy Engine]
Config -->|Cache config| RedisClient[Redis Async Client]

DBClient --> RetryLogic
RedisClient --> RetryLogic

RetryLogic{{"Retry up to N timesnsleep(interval_ms)"}}
RetryLogic --> Logger
```

| Component | Change | Detail |
|----------|--------|--------|
| `config.py` | Add four `@env_settings` fields | `db_max_retries:int=3`, `db_retry_interval_ms:int=2000`, `redis_max_retries:int=3`, `redis_retry_interval_ms:int=2000` |
| `db.py` | Wrap DB connect logic in retry loop | Use `asyncio.sleep()` for interval |
| Redis cache init | Retry connect with same config | Applies if `CACHE_TYPE=redis` |
| Logging | One log per retry attempt | Include attempt count and retry delay |
| README | Add env var docs | Match style of existing DB/Redis config

---

### 🔗 MCP Standards Check

- [x] No protocol-level breaking changes
- [x] Follows existing env var config conventions
- [ ] Deviations: none

---

### 🔄 Alternatives Considered

| Alternative | Pros | Cons |
|------------|------|------|
| `docker-compose` healthcheck + `depends_on` | Simple for local dev | Doesn’t help bare-metal or k8s |
| Exponential back-off | Faster in some cases | Adds complexity |
| Gunicorn retry preload script | Works for some runners | Not general-purpose

---

### 📓 Additional Context

- Mirrors retry pattern used in `max_tool_retries`
- Naming aligned with `DB_POOL_SIZE`, `CACHE_TYPE`, etc.
- Ensure this is then changed in the helm chart.

Example configuration:

```bash
export DB_MAX_RETRIES=10
export DB_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS=5000
export REDIS_MAX_RETRIES=10
export REDIS_RETRY_INTERVAL_MS=5000
```
comments: I've added: https://github.com/IBM/mcp-context-forge/blob/main/mcpgateway/utils/db_isready.py to support with Database migrations. Should help with this task too.

@reevebarreto:  Retry mechanism still missing from `mcpgateway/db.py` leading to `run-gunicorn.sh` to fail this check:

"${PYTHON}" -m mcpgateway.db
if [[ $? -ne 0 ]]; then
    echo "✘  Database migration/check failed. Please resolve issues before starting the server."
    exit 1
fi

```
  File "/app/mcpgateway/db.py", line 1219, in init_db
    raise Exception(f"Failed to initialize database: {str(e)}")
Exception: Failed to initialize database: (psycopg2.OperationalError) connection to server at "mcp-stack-postgres" (10.104.202.171), port 5432 failed: Connection refused
 Is the server running on that host and accepting TCP/IP connections?
(Background on this error at: https://sqlalche.me/e/20/e3q8)
✘  Database migration/check failed. Please resolve issues before starting the server.
```

The same changes from main also need to be made in db.py otherwise this will not implement a retry mechanism correctly.

You can quickly test this with:
```bash
pip install ".[postgres,redis]"
# Point .env at a DB that isn't running, ex:
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:pass@localhost:5432/mcp
make serve
```

It bails out immediately with:
Exception: Failed to initialize database: (psycopg2.OperationalError) connection to server at "localhost" (127.0.0.1), port 5432 failed: Connection refused                         Is the server running on that host and accepting TCP/IP connections?

Instead of implementing the retry mechanism.

issueDTO.title: Convert Marketing Team section to RST
issueDTO.description:
We are in the process of moving this repository to Read the Docs, and to do that we need to convert our pages from Markdown to RST. This issue is to transfer the Marketing team section: [https://contribute.mautic.org/marketing-team](https://contribute.mautic.org/marketing-team). You can also update and improve the content on these pages if you like - do check with the team lead (cc @sdoering and @tobsowo) first to ensure it's relevant.

You can do this in the current repo, as we've got a folder set up, `/docs`, which will be used for Read The Docs.

You can build this documentation locally by cloning this repository, and following these steps: https://github.com/mautic/user-documentation/tree/5.x?tab=readme-ov-file#build-documentation-locally. Change into the /docs folder and then (assuming you have DDEV and Docker/Colima installed) type `ddev config` and select `build/html `as the root folder when configuring DDEV. Then when complete, type `ddev start` and it'll give you the link to your local testing environment.

If you need to make a link file to add an external URL, please use the command line tool 'make link'. This will generate a reference macro and a link file for you.

For internal linking check the docs on using the [:ref: role](https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/guides/cross-referencing-with-sphinx.html#the-ref-role) for linking within the same document, and using [:doc: to link across pages](https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/guides/cross-referencing-with-sphinx.html#the-doc-role).

**Please note: if you see folders called .revs these are old version control files from Grav. Ignore them! (they should be deleted) and instead work on the actual files.**

When you've converted the file/s, **they need to live within the /docs folder**. We can create a structure using sub-folders to organise the sections. You also need to add the pages to the Table of Contents in the index.rst file for them to show on the menu. Docs on the ToC can be found [here](https://sublime-and-sphinx-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/indices.html).

We highly recommend that you use VS Code with Vale installed. Let us know if you have any problems.

Some useful resources: 
- https://sublime-and-sphinx-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest guide to Sphinx/RST formatting
- https://sublime-and-sphinx-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/references.html#use-the-external-links-extension how to do external links - always check the /docs/links directory first! You can use the terminal command '`make link`' to create the link file automagically.

There are many MD to RST tools out there which can help speed up the process, however you will still need to review your output to ensure it passes our Vale grammar rules. Headings must always be unique, as well.

We use the following for headings:

```
H1 ###
H2 ***
H3 ===
H4 ---
H5 ~~~
```

Please ask in #t-education on Slack if you get stuck with anything!

issueDTO.title: Upvote button (color?) does not change enough when clicked
issueDTO.description: Here is how upvote buttons look like: Perhaps you might think it is easy for me to understand which posts I upvoted. But it looks something like that to me (and some other color-blind people): I am struggling to tell whether I clicked the upvote or not. It is especially bad when I have the comments page open; there are no other "upvote" buttons to compare. Did I upvote this submission? Did I not? I have no idea, just by looking at this: I have to click the upvote button a few times to ensure that my click brought the number up. Perhaps, it is possible to have an easier-to-understand UI?
comments:
Thanks for reporting. This is not an acceptable UI, especially for core site functionality like upvoting.

@ninakali Could you share which tool and setting you used to produce the screenshots? I've used a few over the years and would like to be certain we don't accidentally test with one that doesn't accurately reproduce your problem. The easiest way to ensure that would be to reuse.

Implementor: If it's possible, I'd prefer not to change the 'brand' red upvoted color as it's core UI, though that's secondary to a functional UI. Or to say the reverse, maybe the best first approach would be to lighten the unvoted gray (though this may start looking like a disabled form element) or an outline.


To connect some context: 

#1494 is related and could be done with or separately from this fix. There is even an [insufficiently concerned](https://github.com/lobsters/lobsters/issues/1494#issuecomment-2740754925) comment from me that the proposal might not be accessible; I didn't consider the existing UI.

#1090 is also about this UI but may be stale, I'll post more info there.

I asked for help with this [in chat](https://lobste.rs/chat) and got a suggestion that's deploying now. I don't love the bold, but it is distinct, so we're good until we can come up with more attractive and functional UI.

I used a random website - https://www.colorblindnesstest.org/color-tools/color-blindness-simulator/ - with "achromatomaly" mode. It is difficult to find the mode that would reflect my experience the best. In theory, I have protanomaly, that makes red shades appear less bright and "green-ish", but in practice, an image with "protanomaly" filter still looks somewhat different to an image without any filters. "Achromatomaly" mode looked right because I couldn't quite tell the difference between the image with this filter and without it under the light conditions I've had in my room at the moment. 

Side note: I feel like "true tone" setting set to "On" in MacOS might affect how I see colours. This is a default setting, so I prefer to keep it as is.

repository.description: DataTables bundle for Symfony

summary.main: DataTableExporterResponseEvent should contain an instance of DataTable, allowing event callbacks to determine whether to skip the export if it belongs to another table.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to ensure that the export file name is correct and unique for each table, even when multiple tables are exported on the same page.
summary.attemptedFixes: The suggested fix is to have DataTableExporterResponseEvent contain an instance of DataTable, so that event callbacks can decide whether to skip the export if it belongs to another table. Alternatively, DataTableExporterManager could be fixed to dispatch only events that belong to the exported DataTable.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to multiple tables on the same page with export, where each table adds its own event listener to DataTableExporterEvents::PRE_RESPONSE. This causes the export file name to be overwritten by each event, resulting in incorrect file names.

### I have taken steps to troubleshoot my issue first

issueDTO.title: Add a default logging.yaml when `meltano init` is invoked
issueDTO.description:
Migrated from GitLab: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/3121

Originally created by @edgarrmondragon on 2021-12-15 18:17:31

---

### Problem to solve

Now that structured logs have been added to Meltano by https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2772, it'd be good if new Meltano projects were initialized with a `logging.yaml` containing some good defaults.

### Target audience

Users starting fresh new Meltano projects.

### Further details

- Logging configuration is present from the start
- Users are aware of configurable logging by virtue of the file being present

### Proposal

The initial `logging.yaml` should probably have both the option for colored logs during development, and JSON logs for production scenarios.

The file should probably include a header with some instructions, links, etc.

Where to look for this in the code:

https://github.com/meltano/meltano/blob/0dad7d51a36862e3df7a9f5cf19425540577e5c9/src/meltano/core/bundle/initialize.yml#L1-L2

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

Users start using and configuring structured logging in their Meltano projects. This increased use should bring more contributions as bug reports and feature proposals.

### Regression test
(Ensure the feature doesn't cause any regressions)
- [ ] Write adequate test cases and submit test results
- [ ] Test results should be reviewed by a person from the team

### Links / references

_Please note that this was taken from GitLab, to be changed accordingly_

issueDTO.title: "parameterizable" decorator
issueDTO.description:
## Is your feature request related to a use case or problem? Please explain

Parameterization requires a bunch of boilerplate (`_is_parameterized_`, `_parameter_names_`, `_resolve_parameters_`, all of which just check / replace the specified member variables). It seems like something a decorator could handle well.

## Describe the solution you would prefer

It'd be great if in #5985, the solution could just be "add the decorator to `QasmUGate`", something like 

```python
@parameterizable("theta", "phi", "lmda")
class QasmUGate(ops.Gate):
```

## How urgent is this for you? Is it blocking important work?

<!-- Please choose one of the following options and remove the others -->
**P3** – I'm not really blocked by it; it's an idea I'm proposing based on principle

## Process Note

For anyone wanting to take this issue, it's probably worth a mini [RFC](https://github.com/quantumlib/Cirq/blob/main/docs/dev/rfc_process.md) and finding a maintainer (not me) to sponsor it before starting work (assuming this even gets to triage/accepted state). While it's probably below the "RFC Required" bar, I think there are enough variables, that having an approved design would be beneficial. (Some things that come to mind: What happens if only some fields are parameterizable? Can/should it work both with dataclasses and with non-dataclasses? Can the implementations be overridden in classes it's applied to? How to apply it in gate class hierarchies (e.g. at the EigenGate level or at each subtype?) Does it interact with mypy typing in any way or are type declarations independent? What's the best way to test it? Is it worth going back and retrofitting existing gates into this model?)

repository.name: Cirq

summary.otherNotes: For anyone wanting to take this issue, it's probably worth a mini [RFC](https://github.com/quantumlib/Cirq/blob/main/docs/dev/rfc_process.md) and finding a maintainer (not me) to sponsor it before starting work (assuming this even gets to triage/accepted state).

issueDTO.title: Optimize circuit construction when Insert is used
issueDTO.description:
## Is your feature request related to a use case or problem? Please explain

#6882 created a cache that sped up circuit construction if only "append" (or equivalent "insert" at end w/ EARLIEST strategy) was used. If other types of "insert", "delete", or any other circuit mutation was used (see instances of `_placement_cache = None`), the cache was simply deleted and subsequent mutations (including appends) fell back to the old "check every moment" algorithm.

## Describe the solution you would prefer

There are probably some clever algorithms or data structures that could maintain the placement cache through more types of mutations. Or another option could be if the placement cache was deleted and subsequently the user calls a few "appends" in a row, to assume there are more coming and have some code that regenerates the placement cache a-priori. (It'd be nice to see some real-world use cases of large circuits that use mutations other than "append", to make sure any solution is optimizing the right thing).

## How urgent is this for you? Is it blocking important work?

<!-- Please choose one of the following options and remove the others -->
**P3** – I'm not really blocked by it; it's an idea I'm proposing based on principle

repository.description: An open-source Python framework for creating, editing, and invoking Noisy Intermediate-Scale Quantum (NISQ) circuits.
repository.name: Cirq

summary.main: Optimize circuit construction when 'insert' is used by maintaining the placement cache through more types of mutations or regenerating it a-priori if the user calls a few 'appends' in a row.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires validation of the proposed solutions to ensure they optimize the right thing, possibly by analyzing real-world use cases of large circuits that use mutations other than 'append'.
summary.attemptedFixes: The issue suggests possible solutions such as maintaining the placement cache through more types of mutations or deleting the cache and subsequently regenerating it a-priori if the user calls a few 'appends' in a row.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to #6882, which created a cache to speed up circuit construction when only 'append' or equivalent 'insert' at end with EARLIEST strategy is used. The issue proposes optimizing circuit construction when 'insert' is used, possibly by using clever algorithms or data structures to maintain the placement cache through more types of mutations.

issueDTO.title: Add sysfs helpers
issueDTO.description:
## Background

When debugging anything related to a device driver, the first step is often finding the `struct device` that represents the device in the kernel. One way to find a device is by its sysfs path. However, drgn doesn't currently have an easy way to do that. You can _kind of_ do it with something like:

```
>>> path = path_lookup("/sys/devices/pci0000:00/0000:00:06.0/0000:04:00.0/nvme/nvme0/nvme0n1")
>>> kn = cast("struct kernfs_node *", path.dentry.d_inode.i_private)
>>> kobject = cast("struct kobject *", kn.priv)
>>> device = container_of(kobject, "struct device", "kobj")
```

But this has a few issues:

* Clearly it's not convenient at all.
* `path_lookup()` walks the dentry cache, which may not be populated for a particular path depending on memory pressure.
* `path_lookup()` doesn't resolve symlinks (yet, see #216), so you have to use the canonical path instead of a more convenient symlink like `/sys/block/nvme0n1`.

Instead, we should improve our kernfs helpers and provide sysfs-specific helpers on top of those. This can be broken down into multiple smaller features.

## kernfs

sysfs is actually an instance of [kernfs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kernfs_(Linux)), which is generic infrastructure for pseudo file systems. A kernfs filesystem comprises a tree of [`struct kernfs_node`](https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/include/linux/kernfs.h?id=1d227fcc72223cbdd34d0ce13541cbaab5e0d72f#n181), each of which represents a file or directory.

We already have a few basic helpers for inspecting kernfs: https://drgn.readthedocs.io/en/latest/helpers.html#kernfs. I would like two extensions to those:

- [ ] Add a `kernfs_children()` helper that returns an iterator over the children of a directory in kernfs. Children are represented by [`struct kernfs_node::dir::children`](https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/include/linux/kernfs.h?id=1d227fcc72223cbdd34d0ce13541cbaab5e0d72f#n156).
- [ ] Extend the `kernfs_walk()` helper to follow symlinks. These are represented by [`struct kernfs_node::symlink::target_kn`](https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/include/linux/kernfs.h?id=1d227fcc72223cbdd34d0ce13541cbaab5e0d72f#n171). We should probably also have a `follow_symlinks` parameter that controls what we do if the last component of a path is a symlink, similar to the Python [`os`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/os.html#files-and-directories) module.

## sysfs

Once we have the kernfs changes, we can add sysfs-specific helpers that use the new kernfs features.

- [ ] Add a `sysfs_lookup_node()` helper that returns the `struct kernfs_node *` at a given path.
- [ ] Add a `sysfs_lookup()` helper that returns the actual object (e.g., `struct device *`, `struct bus *`, etc.) represented by a given path.
- [ ] Add a `sysfs_listdir()` helper that lists the names of the children of a sysfs directory at a given path.
comments: I am interested in implementing this.

issueDTO.title: Add SSMRunCommandOperator
issueDTO.description:
### Description

Amazon Systems Manager (SSM) is used by system admins to manage AWS resources like EC2. It also provided ability for companies to run scripts on the EC2 machines securely using it's RunCommand feature. Adding SSM RunCommand Operator to the Amazon provider package will unlock migration to Airflow from legacy job scheduling frameworks like AutoSys

### Use case/motivation

I work with a few customers that are in the process of migrating jobs from AutoSys and other legacy frameworks to Airflow. For these customers, a lot of their existing jobs are in shell scripts running on EC2. When they migrate to Airflow, they are looking for an easy way to lift those scripts and run on Airflow. SSHOperator could be an option for this but in many corporate environments, SSH is disabled for security reasons. One of the secure ways AWS recommends executing a remote script on EC2 is by using SSM RunCommand.

### Related issues

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit a PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

Sure :)

issueDTO.title: [Rolldown] Use `filter` pattern for Vite hooks
issueDTO.description:
### Feature Request

In some plugins WXT uses, we use `resolveId`, `load`, and `transform` to modify specfic files. We need to use [the `filter` feature](https://rolldown.rs/guide/plugin-development#plugin-hook-filters) to take advantage of rust.

The plugins that need updated are in the [`packages/wxt/src/core/builders/vite/plugins` directory](https://github.com/wxt-dev/wxt/tree/main/packages/wxt/src/core/builders/vite/plugins).

There are not unit tests for each of these plugins, but they are covered by E2E tests. So if `pnpm test` passes after your changes, nothing is broken.

#### Is your feature request related to a bug?

Apart of #1677

### What are the alternatives?

Leave it as is and not take advantage of the native rust code.

issueDTO.title: Allow `default` keyword as `update` value for generated columns
issueDTO.description:
MySQL:
```sql
mysql> create table t (i int primary key, j int generated always as (i + 10));
Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.01 sec)

mysql> insert into t (i) values (1);
Query OK, 1 row affected (0.01 sec)

mysql> select * from t;
+---+------+
| i | j    |
+---+------+
| 1 |   11 |
+---+------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

mysql> update t set j = default;
Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.00 sec)
Rows matched: 1  Changed: 0  Warnings: 0
```

Dolt:
```sql
tmp/main> create table t (i int primary key, j int generated always as (i + 10));
Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.02 sec)
tmp/main*> insert into t (i) values (1);
Query OK, 1 row affected (0.01 sec)
tmp/main*> select * from t;
+---+----+
| i | j  |
+---+----+
| 1 | 11 |
+---+----+
1 row in set (0.00 sec) 


tmp/main*> update t set j = default;
The value specified for generated column "j" in table "t" is not allowed.

```
related: https://github.com/dolthub/dolt/issues/9428

repository.description: Dolt – Git for Data
repository.name: dolt

summary.main: MySQL allows updating generated columns with `default` keyword, but Dolt does not. The issue is demonstrated by creating a table with a generated column, inserting a row, and then trying to update the generated column with `default`.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Allow `default` keyword as `update` value for generated columns
summary.otherNotes: related to https://github.com/dolthub/dolt/issues/9428

issueDTO.title: Misleading warning in relational interfaces if user is has no read permission
issueDTO.description: ### Describe the Bug The relational interfaces show the message "The relationship hasn't been configured correctly" if a user is missing read permission on the related collection: This warning is misleading and should be changed to something that indicates that the permissions are missing. Obviously, if the relationship is actually configured incorrectly, the above message should still be displayed. Most likely this requires an adjustment of the relations service, as currently the user doesn't receive the necessary information. ### To Reproduce - Create two collections - Setup a relationship of any kind between the two - Create a role & user - Grant access to main collection, while not granting read access on related / junction collection - Login with the user and create a new item, see the interface with the warning as shown in the screenshot ### Directus Version 10 (up to 10.8.3) ### Hosting Strategy N/A
comments:
Hey 👋 I'd like to work on this issue.
My plan is to adjust the relation service to differentiate between:
a misconfigured relationship (e.g. missing collection or metadata)
and a permission issue (the user lacks read access to the related collection)
The idea is to return a more specific status from the backend (e.g. readable: false) and then update the Admin UI to show a clearer message when access is denied, instead of the generic "relationship not configured" warning.
Would this approach work for you? If so, could you assign the issue to me?
Thanks!

How hard can it be? You don't really need to know anything about OSL internals or even C++ programming. It's mainly about wrangling builds and knowing how such things are done on Windows. Maybe it's even a good Dev Days project? 

[OpenImageIO](https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/OpenImageIO)'s build and CI system is basically the same as OSL's, and it has Windows builds in its CI, so that should provide much of the template (and existence proof) for how this can be done. Probably the hardest part is that unlike OIIO, OSL will need LLVM installed as a dependency.

issueDTO.title: [FR]: New Evaluaton Metric "Trajectory Accuracy"
issueDTO.description:
### Proposal summary

We like to extend the existing evaluation metrics to include a new metric called "Trajectory Accuracy". Esentially we are evaluating ReAct style agents by reasoning about the sequence of actions taken and their outcomes. Based on the paper “ReAct: Synergizing Reasoning and Acting in Language Models” https://arxiv.org/abs/2210.03629. You can also see the Langchain implementation here:
- https://python.langchain.com/api_reference/langchain/evaluation/langchain.evaluation.agents.trajectory_eval_chain.TrajectoryEvalChain.html
- https://github.com/langchain-ai/agentevals/tree/main/python/agentevals/trajectory

Example of an existing judge metric (Hallucination) is defined here:
- Docs: https://www.comet.com/docs/opik/evaluation/metrics/hallucination
- Docs Code: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/apps/opik-documentation/documentation/fern/docs/evaluation/metrics/hallucination.mdx
- Python SDK: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/tree/main/sdks/python/src/opik/evaluation/metrics/llm_judges/hallucination
- Python Examples: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/sdks/python/examples/metrics.py
- Frontend: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/apps/opik-frontend/src/constants/llm.ts

Ideally this is implemented as an LLM-as-a-judge. Expectation is the new judge is added to the frontend for using LLM-as-a-judge from the UI (Online Evaluation tab) as well as in the Python SDK. The appropriate docs needs to be updated and a video attached of the metric working.

Return should be float (0-1), and if its using LLM as a eval then should also contain a "reason/explanation"

### Motivation

I would like to see more robust set of metrics and evaluations based on recent research.

issueDTO.title: Outline Manager fails to create GCP server
issueDTO.description:
### Application

Outline Manager

### Describe the bug

When using GCP option in "ADD SERVER" tab the app hangs on create server step. 
The problem is connected to missing `projects/ubuntu-os-cloud/global/images/family/ubuntu-2004-lts` image that should be used when creating a compute engine instance. 

In GCP logs for compute engine the following error message can be found:
```
The resource 'projects/ubuntu-os-cloud/global/images/family/ubuntu-2004-lts' was not found
```
For reference see [Operating system details](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/images/os-details#ubuntu_lts) section of Compute Engine Documentation. It clearly states that EOS and image deprecation date for tis image is May 2025. 

I suspect the error can be easily fixed by updating [this line](https://github.com/Jigsaw-Code/outline-apps/blob/55d09c01704909e1142fd14e2a91d5525872efd0/server_manager/www/gcp_account.ts#L275), but I'm not sure what image is to be used (otherwise I could try to open a PR). 

### Steps to reproduce

1. open Outline Manager
2. connect to GCP account
3. create a project using "ADD SERVER" tab
4. create server using on of the locations (same behaviour is observed for multiple server locations)

### What did you expect to happen?

Successfully completed addition of new server as it was before.

### What actually happened?

I've tried to create a new GCP server using the respective option in "ADD SERVER" tab. 

### Outline Version

1.17.2

### What operation system are you using?

macOS

### Operating System Version

Sonoma 14.6.1

### Screenshots and Videos

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Change default `rot_method` value from `'pca'` to `'pcahog'`
issueDTO.description:
### Context

While investigating a [user forum issue](https://forum.spinalcordmri.org/t/images-with-different-orientations-fields-of-view/633), I noticed that when not specifying the `-param` flag, the default `rot_method` is set to `pcahog`:

https://github.com/spinalcordtoolbox/spinalcordtoolbox/blob/c5aa82554e4b76262492ff3a7de238ea3c87fd03/spinalcordtoolbox/scripts/sct_register_to_template.py#L60

However, when setting `-param`, the default `rot_method` switches to `pca`, which is counterintuitive:

https://github.com/spinalcordtoolbox/spinalcordtoolbox/blob/ae939b1c3be5f9def829562c82a45cb9dda8dabb/spinalcordtoolbox/registration/algorithms.py#L662-L667

https://github.com/spinalcordtoolbox/spinalcordtoolbox/blob/ae939b1c3be5f9def829562c82a45cb9dda8dabb/spinalcordtoolbox/registration/algorithms.py#L47-L51

Moreover, the `pca` method seems to be less performant (a paper from @Nicolas-Pinon is cooking, demonstrating the better performance of pcahog).

### Suggestion

Set default `rot_method` to be `pcahog`

issueDTO.title: No way to copy selected text ?
issueDTO.description:
Hello,

Kudos for the great job !

I've got some issues though :

Using pywinauto I navigate to an input text.
Using type_keys (^a^c) I can select the text, and copy it to the clipboard (I can paste it using ctrl+v manually).
But there doesn't seem to be a way to retrieve it programmatically.
Or am I mistaken ?

In the doc there is a mention to pywinauto.clipboard, but it doesn't work at all for me :

```
>python -m pip install pywinauto --upgrade
Requirement already up-to-date: pywinauto in python\python36\lib\site-packages (0.6.4)
...

>python
Python 3.6.0a1 (v3.6.0a1:5896da372fb0, May 17 2016, 16:21:39) [MSC v.1900 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import pywinauto
>>> pywinauto.clipboard
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: module 'pywinauto' has no attribute 'clipboard'
```

Any help would be much appreciated, thank you for your time.
comments: Found a workaround copying the text in notepad.exe, saving it, and reading the file from python...
`from pywinauto import clipboard` is working. Anyway thanks for the report. I think we should make it available the way you tried. I'll re-open it as enhancement for the future.
@vasily-v-ryabov  How about the approach mentioned [here](https://stackoverflow.com/a/101167/7433942) ?
@badari412 nothing new. I had no time for higher priority issues than this. Also this approach is incomplete, because waiting some lock is required (this is not implemented now).
I would like to work on this issue.

So I tried it on my computer and everything seems to work perfectly fine.
Although what I am not able to understand is how it didn't work for @lc-thomas. It could possibly be that there was something wrong with the import, or maybe the module at the time (2018) was built different, but I would indeed like to investigate further. So if it is possible, could somebody fill me in on the details of the error :D ?

issueDTO.title: Add `SessionConfig` reference to `ScalarFunctionArgs`
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem or challenge?

- Now that https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/13290 is merged (thanks @joseph-isaacs) we have a place to add new 

@Omega359  [noted](https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/13290#discussion_r1852255032) that by adding `SessionConfig` to the `ScalarFunctionArgs`   unblock several tasks such as
- https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/13212
- https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/12892
- https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/10744

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add `&SessionConfig` to `ScalarFunctionArgs`, and ideally add a test that shows the config gets through.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

We should try and get this done before DataFusion 44 is released so it isn't a breaking change
- #13334
comments: Well, small issue. `ScalarFunctionArgs` is in `datafusion-expr` which can't use `SessionConfig` directly since it's in `datafusion-execution` which depends on `datafusion-expr` which would cause a circular dependency. We can use `ConfigOptions` there which would give us access to all config except the opaque extensions in `SessionConfig` which I think is acceptable.
Great work!
Started delving into this trying to find a good way to impl. Trying to add `config_options: ConfigOptions` to `ScalarFunctionExpr` Having lots of fun with eq and hash with SessionConfig and f64 atm.
I wonder if we can use this trait: https://docs.rs/datafusion/latest/datafusion/catalog/trait.Session.html

We could but it wouldn't solve the issue. The issue is PhysicalExpr requires implementations to impl Eq and Hash or to have implementations for DynEq and DynHash. That is fine until something like SessionConfig which doesn't is introduced. I am looking at updating the either the 'config_namespace' macro or add explicit implementations for 'ScalarFunctionExpr' to try and impl either of the above and use f64.to_bits() and f64::from_bits(..) to handle the problematic f64's in the config. I think it's possible
It makes sense to me to move `SessionConfig` to common or common-runtime crate
take

> It makes sense to me to move `SessionConfig` to common or common-runtime crate

I agree
~~I mistyped above - I meant we couldn't use SessionContext, not SessionConfig. Sorry about the confusion.~~ ... or not. I need more caffeine today. PR uses ConfigOptions.
I guess we can also add `nullable` info to `ScalarFunctionArgs` https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/11923

> I guess we can also add `nullable` info to `ScalarFunctionArgs` #11923

It might already be present in `ScalarFunctionArgs::data_type` 🤔 : https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/f2de2c4cc2009d9b6965f7951fd543e1974fcd2c/datafusion/expr/src/udf.rs#L336

> Not really, DataType has no nullable info, we have to send nullable to ScalarFunctionArgs

Ah I was thinking about the nullable info that is part of embedded `Field`s   -- but that only affects Lists/Maps, etc

> Add SessionConfig reference to ScalarFunctionArgs

This is pretty heavy dependency.
SessionConfig contains a LOT of information no scalar function should depend on and very little that has legitimate usage.
I would prefer not adding SessionConfig to ScalarFunctionArgs. Rather, we could add a stripped down config object dedicated to scalar functions. If time zone is all we need, we should add the time zone directly to `ScalarFunctionArgs` (like proposed in https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16573).

https://docs.rs/datafusion/latest/datafusion/execution/config/struct.SessionConfig.html is mostly a wrapper around the ConfigOptions

If we just want specific fields, we could perhaps reuse the existing ExecutionProps

I think the challenge is that 
1. The subset of `ConfigOptions` that functions might want to access is not clear to me
2. User defined functions may well want to use settings we haven't anticipated (and SessionConfig has a user defined way to pass it)

That doesn't mean we couldn't copy a subset of the fields into ScalarFunctionArgs, it just seems unecessary to try and pick that subset 🤔

> If we just want specific fields, we could perhaps reuse the existing ExecutionProps

Are AliasGenerator and VarProviders relevant to function implementors?

> The subset of ConfigOptions that functions might want to access is not clear to me

It's not clear to me either.  We know about session time zone. Session start time may be relevant.
Do we need to know all of them from the start, or just anticipate we gonna evolve set of what's accessible as the need arises?

By avoiding full SessionConfig / ConfigOptions, I would like to retain the state where it's very easy to invoke a function, either from a test, a benchmark, or any other execution context. 

Exposing sub-configs such SqlParserOptions, ExplainOptions, or OptimizerOptions to UDFs looks like breaking abstractions, or invitation to break abstractions.

I think my next attempt at solving this was to take the same approach that async-udf took - which is to move the invocation of the udf into an [ExecutionPlan](https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/0143b20de3f9e25ab8d87ef4b96b78c28e462bee/datafusion/physical-plan/src/async_func.rs#L130). That approach provides the full config_options.

> Exposing sub-configs such SqlParserOptions, ExplainOptions, or OptimizerOptions to UDFs looks like breaking abstractions, or invitation to break abstractions.


In light of a push to reduce breaking changes like https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/16622 (and https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16078, https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16541, https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/13648) we could try to be more judicious about growing the public API. IF we don't need to expose full SessionConfig / ConfigOptions in ScalarFunctionArgs let's maybe not expose them.

> In light of a push to reduce breaking changes like https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/16622 (and https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16078, https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16541, https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/13648) we could try to be more judicious about growing the public API. IF we don't need to expose full SessionConfig / ConfigOptions in ScalarFunctionArgs let's maybe not expose them.

My counter argument is that having to add new fields to ExecutionProps basically increases the public API over time. `ConfigOptions` is already public so it is my opinion that exposing just the `ConfigOptions` is less API surface area. I can see how there are alternate opinions to this

Here is what passing in the entire ConfigOptions looks like (it is pretty straightforward actually): https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/16661

issueDTO.title: Improve test code coverage
issueDTO.description:
Thanks to @okBrian we now have test code coverage (the badge is in the MFC readme). However, we are only at 50% or so. See the lines of code not covered by the test suite here: https://app.codecov.io/github/MFlowCode/MFC/tree/master/src

One fun idea that, in part, addresses this, is using a fuzzer across the inputs to be sure the user does use initial conditions (`case.py` variables) that are nonsense or incompatible.
comments:
We have had several great PRs that improve the code and pass the tests, without hurting performance. We even have #881 from @Malmahrouqi3 to benchmark on Frontier as well. This is great.

I've noticed in my own experimentation, plus reviewing these PRs, that my biggest concern is that we just don't have enough tests. A lot of code is untouched by the test suite. Codecov is not the perfect tool here, because it has a little trouble parsing fypp -> f90, so it marks some lines as not covered that are actually covered. Still, there are things like the output files, the probes, data transfer between simulation -> post_process, and so on. 

The code is not so hard to refactor, but there are some areas that are concerning. I suspect that #914 is a side effect of me or someone else's PR (I could be wrong). This case simply wasn't tested in CI appropriately.

There is a tango required to get decent tests without overfitting to specific computers or spending 10 hours in CI running (plus another 10 hours queuing in some cases). But I would rather have good tests so we can more confidently refactor and add features than be cavalier about merging quite important changes into the code. 

An example is #907 from @XZTian64 or #855 (and similar) from @Malmahrouqi3 and #901 from me. I'm not fully confident that nothing will go wrong in merging these, despite the tests. The ones that involve writing probes or post_process are most concerning at the moment, I think.

issueDTO.title: Forward and back fill of null and NaN values
issueDTO.description:
### Discussed in https://github.com/Eventual-Inc/Daft/discussions/4679
Originally posted by **mikeprince4** July 1, 2025 I see there's a `fill_null()` method, but it's unclear if it's possible to leverage this to get the same behavior as I would with a `pandas.fillna(method='ffill')`. Any ideas how to do this best?
# Feature Request The ability to fill null or NaN values based on the previous or next non-null/NaN value in the column. The API could look something like this, or by using a window function: ``` df = daft.from_pydict({"a": [1, None, 3]}) df.fill_null(strategy="forward").show() # should result in [1, 1, 3] df.fill_null(strategy="back").show() # should result in [1, 3, 3] ``` Related functions in other libraries: - [Pandas](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/reference/api/pandas.DataFrame.fillna.html) - [Polars](https://docs.pola.rs/api/python/dev/reference/dataframe/api/polars.DataFrame.fill_null.html)

issueDTO.title: bug(flags): Scheduling a new condition does not reset the rollout value
issueDTO.description:
### Bug Description

Saving a scheduled change to a feature flag has some confusing client-side behavior.

## How to reproduce

1. Navigate to a feature flag
2. Click on the Schedule Tab
3. Schedule a new condition
4. Click Schedule.

Expected: The schedule to be added and the rollout % to be cleared.
Actual: The rollout % is the same, but now we show a confusing error that the user needs to set the rollout % value

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6196e7cb-a9f5-453e-b5f4-fc71580d9619)


### Debug info

```shell
- [ ] PostHog Cloud, Debug information: [please copy/paste from https://us.posthog.com/settings/project-details#variables or https://eu.posthog.com/settings/project-details#variables]
- [ ] PostHog Hobby self-hosted with `docker compose`, version/commit: [please provide]
- [ ] PostHog self-hosted with Kubernetes (deprecated, see [`Sunsetting Kubernetes support`](https://posthog.com/blog/sunsetting-helm-support-posthog)), version/commit: [please provide]
```
comments:
I created a quick prototype to propose a UX fix for this issue.

**Prototype:**  

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0640b28f-308f-4407-ae43-2d228fee5437

---

### Problem

After scheduling a rollout (e.g. 20% in 17 days), the original rollout % input in the **Overview** tab stays active. This causes:

- Confusing validation errors
- Two conflicting rollout sources
- A broken mental model

---

### Proposed Fix (shown in the prototype)

1. User adds a scheduled rollout via the **Schedule** tab.
2. Only after selecting a date and time, the release condition fields appear (progressive disclosure).
3. The **Overview** tab updates to clearly show the scheduled rollout date and percentage.

This makes the state clear, avoids user errors, and reinforces the schedule as the single source of truth.

Let me know your thoughts! Happy to refine it!

I like it! However, we don't allow editing a schedule. So after you click "Schedule", we should probably reset the state of the form so a person can schedule their next change should they so choose. Keeping the rollout field around is confusing.

summary.main: The issue is about scheduling a new condition for a feature flag, which does not reset the rollout value, causing confusion and errors for users.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue is related to the client-side behavior of saving a scheduled change to a feature flag, and the requirement is to clear the rollout percentage after scheduling a new condition.
summary.attemptedFixes: A prototype has been proposed to fix the issue, which includes progressive disclosure of the release condition fields after selecting a date and time, and updating the Overview tab to show the scheduled rollout date and percentage.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is reproducible by navigating to a feature flag, scheduling a new condition, and then clicking Schedule. The expected behavior is that the schedule is added and the rollout percentage is cleared, but instead, the rollout percentage is the same, and an error message appears.

issueDTO.title: Option to delete secret when build_key_vault_name is supplied
issueDTO.description:
<!--- Please keep this note for the community --->

#### Community Note

* Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
* Please do not leave "+1" or other comments that do not add relevant new information or questions, they generate extra noise for issue followers and do not help prioritize the request
* If you are interested in working on this issue or have submitted a pull request, please leave a comment

<!--- Thank you for keeping this note for the community --->

Please search the existing issues for relevant feature requests, and use the
reaction feature
(https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/)
to add upvotes to pre-existing requests.

#### Description

When using a key vault not created by packer, using build_key_vault_name, the secret created by packer is reused and new versions are added. The version is never disabled and the secret is not removed at the end of the packer run though and this has implication if the key vault is being backed up (500 version limit on backups and performance impacts).

It would be nice to have an option to delete the secret at the end to avoid the potential for hitting the limit and to avoid the performance impact that their documentation notes.

#### Use Case(s)

Allow for meeting company policy dictating key vault security and backup requirements without impact.

#### Potential configuration

```
build_key_vault_secret_delete = true 
```

#### Potential References
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/key-vault/general/service-limits#backup-keys-secrets-certificates
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/key-vault/general/service-limits#limits-on-count-of-keys-secrets-and-certificates
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/keyvault/secrets/delete-secret/delete-secret?view=rest-keyvault-secrets-7.4&tabs=HTTP

repository.description: Packer plugin for Azure Virtual Machine Image Builders
repository.name: packer-plugin-azure

summary.main: When using a key vault not created by packer, using build_key_vault_name, the secret created by packer is reused and new versions are added. The version is never disabled and the secret is not removed at the end of the packer run though and this has implication if the key vault is being backed up (500 version limit on backups and performance impacts). It would be nice to have an option to delete the secret at the end to avoid the potential for hitting the limit and to avoid the performance impact that their documentation notes.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Option to delete secret when build_key_vault_name is supplied
summary.otherNotes: Please vote on this issue by adding a 👍 reaction to the original issue to help the community and maintainers prioritize this request
