issueDTO.title: Create Archive Folder if None Exists
issueDTO.description:
### Checklist

- [X] I have used the search function to see if someone else has already submitted the same bug report.
- [X] I will describe the problem with as much detail as possible.

### App

Thunderbird for Android

### App version

8.0b4

### Where did you get the app from?

Google Play

### Android version

14

### Device model

Samsung Galaxy S23

### Steps to reproduce

Attempt to archive an email without an archive folder, It fails.

### Expected behavior

Thunderbird desktop creates an archive folder when a message is archived - even if an archive folder doesn't exist. TB for Android should do the same.

### Actual behavior

Currently Thunderbird for Android does not generate an archive folder.

### Logs

_No response_
comments: Related to #7062 ?
Coming back to this, @kewisch I do think we should bring this inline with desktop.

Sounds reasonable. I think we'll have to explore:

* Can we differentiate between no archive folder set because of explicit user choice, or because no decision made? I think yes, if the "Auto" setting is on for the archive folder.
* How well does this work for providers like Gmail that have special archive folders, and for the case where TfA might not have detected the archive folder correctly?
* Do we need to do anything special for localization? See also #6799 

This probably isn't terribly complicated, I'll mark this as a good first bug.
We may be tackling this as part of https://github.com/thunderbird/thunderbird-android/issues/7062 . If someone wants to work on this please check in beforehand.
@rafaeltonholo by chance did you do this as part of #7062?

> [@rafaeltonholo](https://github.com/rafaeltonholo) by chance did you do this as part of [#7062](https://github.com/thunderbird/thunderbird-android/issues/7062)?

Currently, folder creation only occurs with a swipe gesture. To implement this functionality, the following steps are necessary:

1. Add a new step in the "Setup Archive Folder" dialog to list the accounts associated with the selected messages.
2. Once the user selects an account, proceed with creating the folder.
3. Ensure that the dialog does not dismiss after the folder is created if more than one account requires an archive folder.
4. Execute the archiving action only after the folder creation is complete.

The current behavior is that the app does not generate an archive folder. The expected behavior is that the app should create an archive folder when a message is archived, similar to Thunderbird desktop. The issue has been discussed and it seems that it is not a trivial task, as it involves differentiating between no archive folder set because of explicit user choice or because no decision made, and also considering providers like Gmail that have special archive folders.

issueDTO.title: Avoid excessive use of `toarray` in unit tests
issueDTO.description:
Many of our unit tests compute the 2-norm of an error vector and compare it to a given tolerance. To this aim, unfortunately, they often convert a Psydac vector to a NumPy array, which is unnecessarily expensive:
```python
error = a - b
assert np.linalg.norm(error.toarray()) < TOL
```
Instead, the same result can be obtained by using the method `inner` of our `Vector` objects, without any unnecessary memory allocation:
```python
# Define 2-norm of vector using inner
norm2 = lambda v: sqrt(v.inner(v))

error = a - b
assert norm2(error) < TOL
```
comments:
While refactoring the `test_operator_evaluation` function (`/linalg/tests/test_linalg.py`) to remove all `.toarray() `(to better leverage PSYDAC’s native vector/matrix structures and improve efficiency), I noticed that the current computation of the variable `error_est` relies on a full dense inverse via:

```
Bmat = B.toarray()

B_inv_mat = np.linalg.inv(Bmat)
b_inv_arr = np.matrix.flatten(B_inv_mat)
error_est = 2 + n1 * n2 * np.max([np.abs(b_inv_arr[i]) for i in range(len(b_inv_arr))])

```
Since we’re avoiding those dense NumPy operations for performance and memory reasons, I believe this calculation of `error_est` no longer fits well in the new context. Computing the full inverse matrix is computationally expensive and somewhat contradictory to the iterative sparse methods we’re testing.

Could you suggest an alternative approach for `error_est`?
For example, I’m considering replacing it with a simpler, lightweight estimate such as:

`error_est = {some num > 0}* n1 * n2`

This is an error estimate based on the maximum absolute value of the inverse matrix. It could read in fact
```python
error_est = np.linalg.norm(Bmat.flat, np.inf)
```
which is the inf-norm of the vectorized matrix. This does not seem to give a sharp estimate, given that it is multiplied by a small number just below (`tol = 1e-5`). Maybe @jowezarek could shed some light on this?

@anushkasinghh @yguclu 
Thanks for bringing this up, this code snipped is ridiculously complicated and doesn't do what it's supposed to do :')

The explicit matrix inverse was never truly needed, and yet there's no time to gain as the entire test ran in < 3 seconds on my machine.

This particular part of the test was designed to test whether power operations (**0, **1, **2) work with inverse linear operators (ILOs).

The poorly executed idea of the test was the following:
```python
# arbitrary tolerance
tol = 

# Define 2-norm of vector using inner (as proposed by Yaman)
norm2 = lambda v: sqrt(v.inner(v))

# Psydac objects, solver with tolerance = tol
u
B_ILO = inverse(B, 'cg', tol=tol)

# First test: Check whether B_ILO**0 is the identity matrix (B_ILO**0 = id?)

error = (B_ILO**0) @ u - u
assert norm2(error) < 1e-15 # error should really be zero

# Second test: Check whether B_ILO**1 really computes the inverse up to accuracy (B_ILO**1 = B_ILO?)
# I.e., we expect B @ B_ILO**1 @ u to be equal to u + err, err a vector of norm less than tol

error = B @ B_ILO**1 @ u - u
assert norm2(error) < tol

# Third test: Now checking whether B_ILO**2 is really equal to a double application of B_ILO (B_ILO**2 = B_ILO @ B_ILO?)
# B @ B @ B_ILO @ B_ILO @ u = B @ ( B_ILO @ u + err1 ) = u + err2 + B @ err1
# where both err1 and err2 are vectors of norm less than tol, hence
# | B @ B @ B_ILO @ B_ILO @ u - u | = | err2 + B @ err1 | < | err2 | + | B @ err1 | < tol + |B|_{inf} * tol = (1 + |B|_{inf}) * tol

adjusted_tol = ( 1 + np.max(np.abs(B.toarray())) ) * tol
error = B @ B @ B_ILO**2 @ u - u
assert norm2(error) < adjusted_tol

repository.description: Python 3 library for isogeometric analysis
repository.name: psydac

summary.main: The main issue is that the current computation of `error_est` is computationally expensive and unnecessary, and it is suggested to use alternative approaches that are more efficient and accurate.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to improve the efficiency of the unit tests by avoiding unnecessary memory allocation and computation. The validation involves checking the correctness of the test results and ensuring that the alternative approaches for `error_est` are accurate and efficient.
summary.attemptedFixes: Several alternative approaches for `error_est` have been suggested, including a simpler, lightweight estimate, and the inf-norm of the vectorized matrix. The explicit matrix inverse was never truly needed, and the test was designed to test whether power operations (**0, **1, **2) work with inverse linear operators (ILOs).
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about avoiding excessive use of `toarray` in unit tests, specifically in the `test_operator_evaluation` function. The current computation of `error_est` relies on a full dense inverse via `np.linalg.inv(Bmat)`, which is computationally expensive and contradictory to the iterative sparse methods being tested.

The purpose of this issue is to conduct a final review of the Identities mobile page on the Starknet ID platform. Here are the key details:

### Issue Details
- This is a final review task to ensure all related issues have been correctly implemented.
- The review should verify that components are properly arranged and match exactly with the Figma design.
- Two Figma design links are provided for reference.

### Actions to Take
1. **Fork and Branch Creation**:
   - Fork the repository and create a new branch using the issue number.

2. **Review and Verification**:
   - Check that all components related to the Identities mobile page have been developed correctly.
   - Ensure the layout and arrangement match exactly with the Figma designs.
   - Verify that all previous sub-issues have been properly addressed.

3. **Testing and Validation**:
   - Test the functionality of the Identities mobile page.
   - Ensure the changes integrate properly with other components.

4. **Commit and Submission**:
   - Make a commit with a clear message describing the final review.
   - Submit a pull request closing the issue.


## Proposed Actions 🛠️

Here’s a checklist of actions to follow for resolving this issue:

1. **Fork and Create Branch**:  
   Fork the repository and create a new branch using the issue number:
   ```bash
   git checkout -b fix-[issue-number]
   ```

2. **Implement Changes**:  
	[Insert Code snippet if needed with a mardown todo list]

3. **Run Tests and Commit Changes**:  
   Make sure your changes don't break existing functionality and commit with a clear message:
   ```bash
   git commit -m "Fix: [Short description of the fix]"
   ```

## Required 📋

To keep our workflow smooth, please make sure you follow these guidelines:

- **Assignment**: Don't create a pull request if you weren’t assigned to this issue.
- **Timeframe**: Complete the task within **3 business days**.
- **Closing the Issue**: In your PR description, close the issue by writing `Close #[issue_id]`.
- **Review Process**:
  - Once you've submitted your PR, change the label to **"ready for review"**.
  - If changes are requested, address them and then update the label back to **"ready for review"** once done.
- **Testing**: Test your PR locally before pushing, and verify that tests and build are working after pushing.

Thank you for your contribution 🙏

⚠️ WARNING: Failure to follow the requirements above may result in being added to the OnlyDust blacklist, affecting your ability to receive future rewards.

issueDTO.title: Verify signature locally
issueDTO.description:
## Description 📹

**Currently, verifying signatures on Starknet via `is_valid_signature` fails if the account is not deployed. This leads to the error: "your wallet is not yet initialized, please make a transaction (sending ETH to yourself works) to initialize it." To support undeployed accounts, we propose directly verifying the signature using the public key (account address), bypassing the need to interact with the account's contract.**

## Proposed Actions 🛠️

Here’s a checklist of actions to follow for resolving this issue:

1. **Fork and Create Branch**:  
   Fork the repository and create a new branch using the issue number:
   
```bash
   git checkout -b fix-[issue-number]
```

2. **Implement Changes**:  
- [ ] Create a utility function to verify Starknet signatures using public keys directly.
- [ ] Integrate this function as a fallback when account is not yet deployed.
- [ ] Detect if an account is deployed or not before calling `is_valid_signature`.
- [ ] Add error handling and logging for both methods of verification.
- [ ] Write unit tests for both deployed and undeployed account scenarios.

Example snippet for direct signature verification:
```python
def verify_signature(pubkey, message_hash, signature):
    # Apply Starknet signature verification logic using elliptic curve math
    return starknet_ec_verify(pubkey, message_hash, signature)
```

3. **Run Tests and Commit Changes**:  
   Make sure your changes don't break existing functionality and commit with a clear message:
   
```bash
   git commit -m "Fix: Allow signature verification for undeployed Starknet accounts"
```

## Required 📋

To keep our workflow smooth, please make sure you follow these guidelines:

- **Assignment**: Don't create a pull request if you weren’t assigned to this issue.
- **Timeframe**: Complete the task within **3 business days**.
- **Closing the Issue**: In your PR description, close the issue by writing Close #[issue_id].
- **Review Process**:
  - Once you've submitted your PR, change the label to **"ready for review"**.
  - If changes are requested, address them and then update the label back to **"ready for review"** once done.
- **Testing**: Test your PR locally before pushing, and verify that tests and build are working after pushing.

Thank you for your contribution 🙏

issueDTO.title: [Bug Report]: OpenAI Provider Returns 404 Error While Direct API Calls Work Fine
issueDTO.description: ### Version agent-tars/0.2.7 darwin-arm64 node-v22.17.0 ### Issue Type - [ ] Select a issue type 👇 - [ ] Agent TARS Web UI (`@agent-tars/web-ui`) - [ ] Agent TARS CLI (`@agent-tars/server`) - [ ] Agent TARS Server (`@agent-tars/server`) - [x] Agent TARS (`@agent-tars/core`) - [ ] MCP Agent (`@mcp-agent/core`) - [ ] Agent Kernel (`@multimodal/agent`) - [ ] Other (please specify in description) ### Model Provider - [ ] Select a model provider 👇 - [ ] Volcengine - [ ] Anthropic - [x] OpenAI - [ ] Azure OpenAI - [ ] Other (please specify in description) ### Problem Description ## Bug Description Agent TARS consistently returns "404 Resource not found" error when using the OpenAI provider, despite direct OpenAI API calls working correctly with the same API key and network configuration. ## Environment - **Network**: China mainland with proxy configuration - **Proxy**: 127.0.0.1:4780 ## Problem Summary ### ❌ **OpenAI Provider** (FAILS) - **Provider**: `openai` - **Model**: `gpt-4o` - **API Key**: Valid (verified with curl) - **Error**: `404 Resource not found` - **Occurs in**: Both CLI and Web UI ### ✅ **Direct OpenAI API Call** (WORKS) ```bash curl -x http://127.0.0.1:4780 https://api.openai.com/v1/models \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" # Returns normal model list successfully ``` ## Reproduction Steps ### Command Line ```bash agent-tars run \ --input "Find information about UI TARS" \ --model.provider openai \ --model.id gpt-4o \ --model.apiKey {my-api-key} \ --format json ``` **Result:** ```json { "sessionId": "3zvvbfEkWEIYgS2Iz19Nm", "result": { "id": "3526d2b3-bcde-40a2-beb0-9abb1bb6b322", "type": "assistant_message", "timestamp": 1751442535990, "content": "Sorry, an error occurred while processing your request: Error: 404 Resource not found", "finishReason": "error" } ``` ### Web UI ```bash agent-tars \ --provider openai \ --model gpt-4o \ --apiKey {my-api-key} ``` **Result:** Same "404 Resource not found" error in web interface. ## Evidence That API Key and Network Are Valid ### Direct API Verification ```bash # Test 1: List models curl -x http://127.0.0.1:4780 https://api.openai.com/v1/models \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" # ✅ SUCCESS: Returns complete model list # Test 2: Chat completion curl -x http://127.0.0.1:4780 https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions \ -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{"model":"gpt-4o","messages":[{"role":"user","content":"Hi"}],"max_tokens":1}' # ✅ SUCCESS: Returns valid response ``` Both direct API calls work perfectly with the same API key and proxy configuration. ## Configuration Attempted ```typescript // agent-tars.config.ts import { defineConfig } from '@agent-tars/interface'; export default defineConfig({ model: { provider: 'openai', id: 'gpt-4o', apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY, }, browser: { control: 'dom', }, }); ``` ## Comparison with Other Providers - **Doubao (volcengine)**: ✅ Works perfectly in Agent TARS - **OpenAI**: ❌ 404 error in Agent TARS, ✅ works with direct API calls I'm wondering if this issue is related to my local environment, or Agent TARS itself. Thank you! ### Error Logs

issueDTO.title: layers control closes too quickly
issueDTO.description:
### Checklist

- [x] I've looked at the [documentation](https://leafletjs.com/reference.html) to make sure the behavior isn't documented and expected.
- [x] I'm sure this is an issue with Leaflet, not with my app or other dependencies (Angular, Cordova, React, etc.).
- [x] I've searched through the [current issues](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/issues) to make sure this hasn't been reported yet.
- [x] I agree to follow the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) that this project adheres to.

### Steps to reproduce

Users are complaining that the layer control disappears too quickly. Especially when you have a long list of layers, its quite tedious to move the mouse cursor down without leaving the hover state. A transition or transition-delay would help, however I have been unable to implement this with pure css. 

I have found a workaround by triggering the collapse manually, however its causes other issues, like re-entering while not clearing older timeouts. Probably needs a debounce fn.
https://plnkr.co/edit/WQyfFctUqs7mNdq9

On another note, a collapseDelay option would work really well to make it customizable.

### Expected behavior

Layer control stays for 1-2 seconds after leaving hover state.

### Current behavior

Layer control disappears instantly after leaving hover state

### Minimal example reproducing the issue

_No response_

### Environment

- Leaflet version: 1.9.3
- Browser (with version): Chrome

comments:
@fyyyyy This is kinda easy, so I would encourage you to try and send a PR for it.

It's about adding a `setTimeout()` at https://github.com/Leaflet/Leaflet/blob/58c267b7c1c530b238742c7f0054abdc11d43054/src/control/Control.Layers.js#L180

...and then storing the return value of that `setTimeout()` call in a class private(ish) property, and calling `clearTimeout()` in the `expand()` method. No need for debounce nor throttle; a flag is sufficient.

Probably there's also a need for a new option in the class, in order to specify the duration of the timeout.

issueDTO.title: API client to throw error instead of None
issueDTO.description:
The Api client should  `raise_for_status()` instead of `None` if there is an error. Like this we can call the API client and give a more meaningful error to the user.

Things to consider:
* The API client should throw but the emissionsTracker should not break, this means that we should try-catch in the emissions tracker.
* One should check as well if in any of the responses we are `if response is None` because now they will throw the error

_Originally posted by @inimaz in https://github.com/mlco2/codecarbon/issues/798#issuecomment-2800035595_
comments: Would be happy to take this one if it's still relevant :)

Noticed a couple of other things when trying to get env setup. 

- project could benefit from using `uv` for dependency resolution (on install and pip compile)

eg. (not sure this is complete, more info [here](https://juftin.com/hatch-pip-compile/#configuration-options)

```
# pyproject.toml

[tool.hatch.envs.default]
# pip-compile automate the export of environments.txt
type = "pip-compile"
installer = "uv"
pip-compile-resolver = "uv"
```

- python3.8 tests do not work as installing `urllib==2.5.0` is not possible on py3.8
- test deps don't seem to be separated from build deps
- setting `CODECARBON_ALLOW_MULTIPLE_RUNS` env variable could be done with `pytest-dotenv` setting in `pytest.ini` and adding a `.env.test` file 

All except the second one are somewhat debatable, so not sure the best place to put them - happy to elaborate.

Hello @bcmyguest It is still relevant! Feel free to take it/ask for any questions.

- About the use of `uv`, I agree. I see @benoit-cty already started [a branch to migrate ](https://github.com/mlco2/codecarbon/pull/815) maybe it can be discussed in that PR?
- About test deps not separated from build deps. I think this is only true for the env `api`. Thanks for pointing out. We use it to deploy our API, we could separate it into `api-test` and `api`.
- And about the `pytest.ini`, indeed go ahead!

Hello,

issueDTO.title: setup devcontainer
issueDTO.description:
## 🧱 Devcontainer Setup for Unified Development Environment

### 🎯 Goal

Provide a consistent development environment via Devcontainers to reduce onboarding friction and tooling issues across contributors. This image will be used by all SCORE-related repositories (dozens in total), so it must be robust, reusable, and actively maintained.

---

### ✅ Current Situation

We currently require a number of tools to be installed in addition to Bazel. This includes Python, Graphviz, Bazelisk, and shell autocompletion for Bazel. These tools are not always easy to install correctly across different systems, especially for new contributors.

---

### 🚀 Solution

Implement a reusable Devcontainer setup based on a Docker image that includes all required tools preinstalled. The image should be published to GitHub Container Registry (GHCR) and referenced via `.devcontainer/devcontainer.json` or `.devcontainer.json` in consuming repositories.

**Target image name:** `ghcr.io/eclipse-score/devcontainer`

The base image should include:

- Based on an extended Ubuntu image, quite certainly:
  - `mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/python:1.2-3.12`
- Preinstalled tools:
  - Python (needed for Bazel formatting bug workaround)
  - Graphviz
  - Bazelisk (with current bazel version pre-downloaded)
  - Shell autocompletion for Bazel

---

### 🛠️ Concrete Tasks

- [ ] Create a new GitHub repository (name: `eclipse-score/devcontainer`)
- [ ] Create a `Dockerfile` that installs all required tools
- [ ] Add GitHub Actions workflow to:
  - Build the image
  - Optional: Tag it with semantic version (e.g. `v1.0.0`) and `latest`
  - Push to GHCR under `ghcr.io/eclipse-score/devcontainer`
- [ ] Optional: Add typical metadata to the container
- [ ] Use the image from GHCR in `.devcontainer/devcontainer.json` or `.devcontainer.json` in at least one repo (e.g. `score`)
- [ ] Verify that all tools are functional inside the container
- [ ] Optional: Add documentation (`README.md`) to `eclipse-score/devcontainer`

---

### 🔄 Considered Alternatives

Some tools could theoretically be installed via Bazel, but this was previously evaluated and rejected due to high implementation and maintenance cost. We chose to use system-level tools with clear documentation instead.

---

### 🧠 Notes

- The image will become the base for all development work across the SCORE ecosystem
- Keep it generic, stable, and easy to extend.
- This devcontainer will remain entirely optional, it's just meant to ease the pain of installing all the required tools.

---

### 📚 References

- Example: [`eclipse-score/score/.devcontainer`](https://github.com/eclipse-score/score/tree/main/.devcontainer)
- Docs: [Development Environment Setup](https://eclipse-score.github.io/score/main/contribute/development/development_environment.html#autocompletion-in-the-shell)
comments: This looks quite interesting, I will take a look!
I think I will have a first iteration of a devcontainer ready rather soon. We should then discuss if that is the right thing and how to proceed. I will update this ticket with comments.
@opajonk looking at your draft you should consider starting with mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/python:1.2-3.12 instead if raw ubuntu

I checked also `mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/python:1.2-3.12`. However, that one is based on Debian instead of Ubuntu. A few of the tools have packages which are created for specific Ubuntu releases only. Also, I'd argue that Ubuntu is more often used in "commercial contexts". S-CORE is Open Source, of course, but the primary usage is commercial. Hence, using a commercially supported OS has advantages.

Fine with me, so far I'm workin in that container, but I don't care which one it is, as long as it's working :-)

IMHO `mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/base:ubuntu` would make sense then.

> Beyond git, this image / Dockerfile includes zsh, [Oh My Zsh!](https://ohmyz.sh/), a non-root vscode user with sudo access, and a set of common dependencies for development.

It's not a lot. But it's not nothing. You could also use the features directly instead: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/base-ubuntu/.devcontainer/devcontainer.json

issueDTO.title: feat: Add optional "cancel reminder" for recurring subscriptions
issueDTO.description:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I have searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/rarfell/dimeApp/issues) that already include this feature request, without success.

### Describe the Feature Request

I’d love to have a feature that allows users to set customizable reminder notifications a few days before a recurring expense, especially for subscriptions. This way users get a heads-up and have a chance to cancel before the payment goes through.

### Describe the Use Case

I add a recurring subscription payment (e.g. Spotify on the 15th of each month).
I'd like the option to set a reminder X days before (e.g. 3 days before), so Dime sends me a notification like:

“Your Spotify subscription is going to renew in 3 days — consider canceling if you don’t need it.”

This reduces the risk of forgetting to cancel and incurring charges for services I don’t use anymore.

### Additional Information

_No response_
comments: Hey! this is a great idea—let's look into it.

Hello, that sounds really good.  I have a suggestion that may be related to this issue:

It would be great if the **recurring subscription/expense could have an end date or repeat times.**  
For example, I would sign a contract with the gym for 15 months. In this case, I don't want to bother adding an expense monthly or ending this recurring expense while keeping it in my mind.

Anyway, thanks for the app; I loved it at first glance.

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: Email verification input text field should not be multiline on login screen
issueDTO.description:
### Summary

At the login screen, sometimes we need to enter a verification code received by email, likely when we sign up on a new device. This email verification input field appears after providing the correct username and password. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Freshly install the Commons App
2. Open the app and try to log in with your username and password
3. An email verification input field should appear
4. Make sure email verification input field is focused
5. Tap on the `Enter` button in the software keyboard of Android

### Expected behaviour

The **IME Action** for the email verification input field should be either `Done` or `Go`. Also, the input field's height shouldn't increase when pressing the `Enter` button.

### Actual behaviour

The `Enter` **IME Action** is displayed in the Android's soft keyboard, and tapping that increases the input field's height.

### Device name

Pixel 6

### Android version

Android 14

### Commons app version

Main Branch

_No response_

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e7177768-7721-405e-a838-90b12a1a6a9c

issueDTO.title: 🐛 Bug Report: SMTP username and password aren't validated when updating SMTP settings
issueDTO.description:
### 👟 Reproduction steps

1. Update a project's SMTP settings
2. Use a valid host, port, and secure protocol, but an incorrect username and password
3. Click Update

### 👍 Expected behavior

The update should fail because the username and password are incorrect.

### 👎 Actual Behavior

The SMTP settings are updated successfully.

We use `$mail->SmtpConnecti()` test the connection:

https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/8e021158286cd04b64b391afe86975e23368a52c/app/controllers/api/projects.php#L1684-L1695

However, because `SMTPAuth` isn't set to true, the username and password are not checked.

We need to set `SMTPAuth` like we do in the worker:

https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/8e021158286cd04b64b391afe86975e23368a52c/src/Appwrite/Platform/Workers/Mails.php#L166

### 🎲 Appwrite version

Appwrite Cloud

### 💻 Operating system

Linux

### 🧱 Your Environment

_No response_

### 👀 Have you spent some time to check if this issue has been raised before?

- [x] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### 🏢 Have you read the Code of Conduct?

- [x] I have read the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/appwrite/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

issueDTO.title: Rename Zeebe Cluster to Orchestration Cluster in Deployment Modal
issueDTO.description:
### What should we do?

Rename Zeebe Cluster to Orchestration Cluster in Deployment Modal at least vor version 8.8+

### Why should we do it?

With our streamlined architecture we talk about Orchestration Cluster instead of a Zeebe cluster.
This should be aligned in Desktop Modeler deployment modal

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7b37735a-e2b0-482e-8139-ddbc8f324aa0)
comments: Probably worth to simply rename it consistently, across all Camunda 8 versions.
Do we want to change all occurrences of Zeebe? I noticed another error `Unsupported Zeebe version`, Would `Unsupported Engine version` be better?

> Do we want to change all occurrences of Zeebe? I noticed another error Unsupported Zeebe version, Would Unsupported Engine version be better?

We want to rename to orchestration cluster:

```
Unsupported Zeebe version -> Unsupported orchestration cluster version
```

This should also be reflected across [the documentation](https://docs.camunda.io/docs/next/components/modeler/desktop-modeler/), but we have to ensure to not break existing links used from within the modeler UI, i.e. [this](https://docs.camunda.io/docs/next/components/modeler/desktop-modeler/troubleshooting/#i-cannot-connect-to-zeebe); if we break, then we have to redirect old ones.

issueDTO.description: Email Mar 29, 2023: "I have a question about image scale bars in swift - is there any way to move them around so that they don't block the gold ball, and remove the '60kV SuperScan'?"
comments:
From internal discussion - To be broken down into sub-issues with differing levels of priority.

Adjustable default for the software, which new display items have as standard.  The preferences menu contains these default options so we can adjust it.

Once created, each Display Item can then have their options individually adjustable.  For each Display Item, the Inspector should contain these options for adjustment.  This may include the mini-inspector from double-click.

Options a User can adjust:
Position - Bottom Left, Bottom Middle?, Bottom Right
Background - To resolve the problem when drawing white on white, that can handle opacity.
Toggle Voltage
Toggle Detector Name



Options NOT in scope:
Adjusting font itself (family, colour, scale) and style
Freeform movement of the scalebar
Adjusting the Size/Thickness



Future Developments:
Scalebar style (in-image, outside-image, graphlike axes)
Draw Calibrated Grid

issueDTO.title: Feature: Add entity and keyword extraction capabilities
issueDTO.description:
**Description:**
Implement entity and keyword extraction to identify important information like names, locations, dates, and key terms from extracted text.

**Requirements:**
1. Support basic entity types: PERSON, ORGANIZATION, LOCATION, DATE, EMAIL, PHONE
2. Support keyword extraction using TF-IDF or similar algorithms
3. Make this an optional feature with its own dependency group
4. Results should include entity type, text, and position information
5. Support custom entity patterns via regex

**Implementation Details:**
- Add optional dependency group:
  ```toml
  optional-dependencies.entity-extraction = [
    "gliner>=0.2.0",  # State-of-the-art zero-shot NER, outperforms spaCy
    "keybert>=0.8.0",  # Most accurate keyword extraction
  ]
  ```
- **Library Choice Rationale**: 
  - Use GLiNER for NER based on 2024 benchmarks showing superior zero-shot performance and flexibility compared to spaCy
  - Use KeyBERT for keyword extraction as it provides the highest accuracy among RAKE, YAKE, and KeyBERT
- Add to `ExtractionConfig`:
  ```python
  extract_entities: bool = False
  extract_keywords: bool = False
  keyword_count: int = 10
  custom_entity_patterns: dict[str, str] | None = None  # {"INVOICE_ID": r"INV-\d+"}
  ```
- Add to `ExtractionResult`:
  ```python
  entities: list[Entity] | None = None
  keywords: list[tuple[str, float]] | None = None  # (keyword, score)
  ```
- Create `kreuzberg/_entity_extraction.py` module
- Define `Entity` dataclass with `type`, `text`, `start`, `end` fields

**Testing Requirements:**
- Test entity extraction on various document types
- Test custom pattern matching
- Test keyword extraction with different document lengths
- Mock spacy models in unit tests
- Test handling of missing dependencies
- Verify performance impact is acceptable
comments: I have hands-on experience with Python and NLP libraries like spaCy and NLTK. I've built entity and keyword extraction features before and can deliver clean, well-documented code. I'm reliable, quick to learn, and committed to making valuable contributions to open-source.
go ahead

summary.attemptedFixes: The implementation details include adding an optional dependency group, using GLiNER for NER and KeyBERT for keyword extraction, and defining an Entity dataclass with type, text, start, and end fields.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is for adding entity and keyword extraction capabilities to the kreuzberg repository, with requirements including support for basic entity types, keyword extraction using TF-IDF or similar algorithms, and custom entity patterns via regex.

issueDTO.title: [Blazor] Throw meaningful exception for JSRuntime calls that timeout
issueDTO.description:
Capturing the direction on this into a new issue. We should throw a more meaningful exception to users if JS interop invocations timeout.

Ref: #18875 #21375
comments: @captainsafia can you please fill in the details on what a solution would look like here? Thanks!

We've moved this issue to the Backlog milestone. This means that it is not going to be worked on for the coming release. We will reassess the backlog following the current release and consider this item at that time. To learn more about our issue management process and to have better expectation regarding different types of issues you can read our [Triage Process](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/master/docs/TriageProcess.md).

The fix for this issue will need to be implemented in the `ComponentBase` class ([ref](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/5e49fc336e4464711ff2a8db2e00b9bafb518c78/src/Components/Components/src/ComponentBase.cs)).

Specifically, the exception handling logic that is in question is [here](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/5e49fc336e4464711ff2a8db2e00b9bafb518c78/src/Components/Components/src/ComponentBase.cs#L247). Currently, we ignore all exceptions that occur because a task was cancelled.

We need to add an additional check if the cancellation occurred due to a timeout and throw an exception with a specific message if that is the case.

We've moved this issue to the Backlog milestone. This means that it is not going to be worked on for the coming release. We will reassess the backlog following the current release and consider this item at that time. issueDTO.title: Bug in proxy-cache plugin returning compressed cached content to clients not supporting compression
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Kong version (`$ kong version`)

Kong Enterprise 3.6.1.1

### Current Behavior

I've got reports from users from my API that they get compressed output when the response was cached from another user.

Lets say for instance a `/api/healthz` page is called from one client with gzip compression enabled and then another client makes straight away another call to the same endpoint, then the second client is served the compressed cached content but in a not readable format.

### Expected Behavior

I expected that the proxy-cache plugin does take the compression part in consideration and returns a non-compressed content to the second client.

Or maybe something some possibility to convert compressed cached content to non-compressed content? I don't know exactly.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. add proxy-cache plugin to a route
2. run curl command with compression enabled
   ```console
   curl --compressed https://example.com/api/healthz -v --output -
   ```
4. run curl command without compression right afterwards
   ```console
   curl https://example.com/api/healthz -v --output -
   ```


### Anything else?

This is my Kubernetes resource:

```yaml
apiVersion: configuration.konghq.com/v1
kind: KongPlugin
metadata:
  name: my-cache-1min
  namespace: my-api-v4
config:
  cache_ttl: 60
  content_type:
    - text/plain
    - application/json
    - application/json; charset=utf-8
  request_method:
    - GET
    - HEAD
  response_code:
    - 200
  ignore_uri_case: true
  strategy: memory
plugin: proxy-cache
```
comments:
I'm unsure if we should consider this a bug or a possible improvement. But we could fix this and there's a workaround.
You could use `vary_headers` to include "Accept-Encoding" in the cache key so they will be considered different responses.
The default behavior is not very reasonable. 2 quick ideas:
1. add the "Accept-Encoding" as the default value;
2. handle different encoding especially

issueDTO.title: 🚨FAQs | 常见问题🚨
issueDTO.description:
> [!NOTE]
> Please **avoid** creating issues regarding the following questions, as they might be closed without a response.
> 请**避免**创建与下述问题有关的 issues，这些 issues 可能不会被回复。

> [!TIP]
> Documentation: https://llamafactory.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
> 中文文档：https://llamafactory.readthedocs.io/zh-cn/latest/
> NPU 中文文档：https://ascend.github.io/docs/sources/llamafactory/
> 中文版知乎教程：https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/695287607
> 中文版视频教程：https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1djgRzxEts/

----

### Most of problems / 大多数问题

#### How to update code / 如何更新代码

#### Versions of dependencies conflict / 依赖库版本冲突

#### Supported models are not found / 无法找到已支持的模型

#### llamafactory-cli: command not found / 无法找到命令

Please update repository and install again using the following approach.

请按照以下方式更新仓库并重新安装。

```bash
git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory.git && cd LLaMA-Factory
pip install -e ".[torch,metrics]" --no-build-isolation
```

----

### Out-of-memory / 显存溢出

The out-of-memory (OOM) error during training is usually due to insufficient VRAM of the current device to complete the computation. You can try the following methods to deal with this issue:

1. Reduce the training batch size `per_device_train_batch_size: 1`
2. Replace compute kernels `enable_liger_kernel: true` and `use_unsloth_gc: true`
3. Reduce the maximum sequence length `cutoff_len: 512`
4. Use DeepSpeed ZeRO-3 or FSDP to partition model weights on multiple devices or use CPU offloading
5. Set `quantization_bit: 4` to quantize model parameters (only compatible with LoRA tuning)
6. Use the paged optimizer `optim: paged_adamw_8bit`

模型训练时显存溢出，通常是由于当前某个设备的剩余显存不足以完成计算任务。可尝试下述方法解决：

1. 降低批处理大小 `per_device_train_batch_size: 1`
2. 替换模型算子 `enable_liger_kernel: true` 和 `use_unsloth_gc: true`
3. 降低最大序列长度 `cutoff_len: 512`
4. 使用 DeepSpeed ZeRO-3 或 FSDP 将模型权重拆分到多个设备或使用 CPU Offloading
5. 设置 `quantization_bit: 4` 量化模型参数（仅限于 LoRA 方法）
6. 使用分页低精度优化器 `optim: paged_adamw_8bit`

----

### Unsatisfying fine-tuning results / 微调效果无法令人满意

Unsatisfying fine-tuning results are usually due to insufficient training samples, leading to underfitting. You can try the following methods to deal with this issue:

1. Increase the size of the training dataset
2. Increase the number of epochs `num_train_epochs: 5.0` or steps `max_steps: 1000`
3. Use a larger learning rate `learning_rate: 2.0e-4`
4. Use different fine-tuning method `finetuning_type: freeze` or `finetuning_type: full`

微调效果较差，通常是由于训练样本过少，导致模型欠拟合。可尝试下述方法解决：

1. 增加训练数据集的大小
2. 提高训练轮数 `num_train_epochs: 5.0` 或步数 `max_steps: 1000`
3. 增大学习率 `learning_rate: 2.0e-4`
4. 使用不同的微调方法 `finetuning_type: freeze` 或 `finetuning_type: full`

----

### Corrupted or repeated model responses / 胡乱或重复的模型回答

If this issue occurs before training, it is usually due to using an unaligned (base) model or a mismatched `template`. Please ensure an aligned (instruct/chat) model and correct `template` are used.
If this issue occurs after training, please check if the `template` used for training and inference is consistent. And do not forget to check if the overfitting appeared. You can try decreasing the number of epochs `num_train_epochs` and learning rate `learning_rate` to deal with the overfitting issue.

若该问题发生在训练之前，通常是由于使用了未经对齐（base）的模型或不恰当的模板 `template`，请保证使用对齐后（instruct/chat）的模型和正确的模板 `template`。
若该问题发生在训练之后，请检查训练和推理使用的模板 `template` 是否一致，同时检查是否发生了过拟合。如果发生了过拟合，请减小训练轮数 `num_train_epochs` 和学习率 `learning_rate`。

----

### Training hangs / 训练进程卡住

If distributed training was not enabled, please use the following command to check if the CUDA version of PyTorch is installed correctly:

如果没有使用分布式训练，请使用下述命令检查 CUDA 版本的 PyTorch 是否被正确安装：

```bash
python -c "import torch; print(torch.cuda.is_available())"
```

If distributed training was enabled, try setting the environment variable `export NCCL_P2P_LEVEL=NVL`.

如果使用了分布式训练，请尝试设置环境变量 `export NCCL_P2P_LEVEL=NVL`。

----

### LLaMA Board cannot display datasets / LLaMA Board 无法显示数据集

Please ensure that the working directory when launching the LLaMA Board is the same as the LLaMA-Factory directory.

请确保启动 LLaMA Board 时的工作目录与 LLaMA-Factory 主目录一致。

----

### How to shard model weights on multiple devices / 如何模型权重拆分到多个设备上

During the training phase, please refer to the [examples](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/blob/main/examples/README.md#supervised-fine-tuning-with-deepspeed-zero-3-weight-sharding) about how to use the DeepSpeed ZeRO-3 (recommended) or FSDP.
During the inference phase, please use vLLM to enable the tensor parallelism: [examples](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/tree/main/examples#inferring-lora-fine-tuned-models).

在训练阶段，请参考 [examples](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/blob/main/examples/README_zh.md#%E4%BD%BF%E7%94%A8-deepspeed-zero-3-%E5%B9%B3%E5%9D%87%E5%88%86%E9%85%8D%E6%98%BE%E5%AD%98) 使用 DeepSpeed ZeRO-3（推荐）或 FSDP。
在推理阶段，请使用 vLLM 来开启张量并行：[examples](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/blob/main/examples/README_zh.md#%E6%8E%A8%E7%90%86-lora-%E6%A8%A1%E5%9E%8B).

----

### How to use ORPO or SimPO / 如何使用 ORPO 或 SimPO

Modify the `pref_loss` in [example script](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/blob/main/examples/train_lora/llama3_lora_dpo.yaml) to `orpo` or `simpo`.

将[示例脚本](https://github.com/hiyouga/LLaMA-Factory/blob/main/examples/train_lora/llama3_lora_dpo.yaml) 中的 `pref_loss` 改为 `orpo` 或 `simpo`。

----

### How to debug with VSCode / 如何用 VSCode 调试程序

See #5337

----

### Why the number of examples is small in pre-training / 为什么预训练样本数比实际的少

We automatically use packing in pre-training, where we concatenate multiple samples into one sequence, so the number of examples displayed is less than the actual number.

我们在预训练时候自动使用了 Packing，将多个样本打包成一条序列，因此显示的样本数量会比实际的少。

----

### Will the training data be shuffled / 训练数据是否会被打乱

LLaMA-Factory will randomly shuffle the training data by default. You can use `disable_shuffling` to turn off the shuffling.

LLaMA-Factory 默认会随机打乱训练数据，可使用 `disable_shuffling` 关闭打乱。

----

### How to enable streaming / 如何启用流式数据读取

We recommend shuffling the dataset before training if you want to use streaming. Add the following arguments to your yaml file.

如果您希望使用流式数据读取，请在训练前手动打乱数据。将下面的参数添加到 YAML 文件中。

```yaml
buffer_size: 128
preprocessing_batch_size: 128
streaming: true
accelerator_config:
  dispatch_batches: false
```

----

### How to resolve `Processor was not found` / 如何解决 `Processor was not found`

Please run the following code and paste the full error log to Issue.

请运行下面的代码并粘贴完整报错信息到 Issue。

```python
from transformers import AutoProcessor
processor = AutoProcessor.from_pretrained("path-to-your-model")
```

----

> [!TIP]
> If the problems still exist with the **latest** code, please create an issue.
> 若使用**最新的**代码仍然无法解决问题，请创建一个 issue。

issueDTO.title: tree-sitter-nim inclusion
issueDTO.description:
I recently stumbled upon aider and read that it "...relies on tree-sitter-language-pack to provide pre-packaged versions of tree-sitter language parsers." Unfortunately, a tree-sitter-nim hasn't been included yet.

I found [a forum topic](https://forum.nim-lang.org/t/10214) that linked to three different github repos:

- https://github.com/alaviss/tree-sitter-nim ([some discussion](https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter/discussions/2248))
- https://github.com/aMOPel/tree-sitter-nim
- https://github.com/paranim/tree-sitter-nim

Can any of these be included? Would the authors of these need to be involved? I'm fairly clueless on this topic, so I'm just hoping for some pointers on what it would take to get this done.
comments:
Hi there. 

This package is not affiliated with Aider, although Aider relies on it. 

Anyhow, a PR adding NIM Grammer is welcome. 

It looks like just one of these repos is maintained. Id suggest you try adding this one. Contributions welcome.

issueDTO.title: Implement accurate size storage for Windows `_msize` and `_recalloc`
issueDTO.description:
With snmalloc we can provide a custom meta-data per object that is attached to the standard snmalloc meta-data such as free lists.

https://github.com/microsoft/snmalloc/blob/012138e29f8802157ee430b68a1c64f0ef3fbe0b/src/snmalloc/backend_helpers/commonconfig.h#L89-L103

We could use this feature to store a single bit per object.  The bit being set means the allocation does not consume the whole allocated space.  The last byte then represents how much space is not being used by the allocation, i.e.  17 byte allocation, would have the last byte as 15 (32 - 17) and the bit would be set, whereas a 32 byte allocation would not have the bit set.

repository.name: snmalloc

issueDTO.title: Distinguish error-handling for bulk-imports
issueDTO.description:
Follow-Up to #855 

## Description

Currently some API-Elements - primarily REST-Endpoints for Bulk-Imports - require all items in the bulk input to be unique.
If there are any _logical_ duplicates (some identical key), it fails with a `409 CONFLICT` and error-code e.g. `CLASSIFICATION_ALREADY_EXISTS`.

Http- and Error-Code are both misleading.
The semantics of the latter are overloaded with use cases where insertion of an item into the database fails because the item actually already exists.

Therefore, add a new Error-Type and -Code.

Currently, below occurences are known:
- `ClassificationDefinitionController::importClassifications`
- `WorkbasketDefinitionController::importWorkbaskets`
- `WorkbasketService::setWorkbasketAccessItems`

## Definition of Done

- [ ] Checked for other occurences of the misleading usage of `[Entity]AlreadyExistException`
- [ ] Added a new exception for invalid payloads due to logical duplicates
  - [ ] Added Java-Type
  - [ ] Added Error-Code
  - [ ] Added Contract-Test for Error-Code
- [ ] Affected REST-Endpoints now respond with `400 BAD_REQUEST` if the payload contains _logical_ duplicates
- [ ] Affected REST-Endpoints now respond with the new Error-Code if the payload contains _logical_ duplicates
- [ ] Added tests for the new behaviour & adjusted affected tests

summary.main: Distinguish error-handling for bulk-imports

If there are any _logical_ duplicates (some identical key), it fails with a `409 CONFLICT` and error-code e.g. `CLASSIFICATION_ALREADY_EXISTS`.

  - Added Java-Type
  - Added Error-Code
  - Added Contract-Test for Error-Code
- Affected REST-Endpoints now respond with `400 BAD_REQUEST` if the payload contains _logical_ duplicates
- Affected REST-Endpoints now respond with the new Error-Code if the payload contains _logical_ duplicates
- Added tests for the new behaviour & adjusted affected tests
summary.otherNotes: Follow-Up to #855

issueDTO.description:

<!--- Complete *all* sections as described, this form is processed automatically -->

##### SUMMARY
<!--- Explain the problem briefly below -->
The ios_vlans module tries to issue a 'no mtu 1500' command if the VLAN is created without specifying an MTU.  This syntax is not accepted by IOS.  Specifying the MTU works for a single VLAN but fails if there are multiple VLANs.

##### CONFIGURATION

```paste below

DEFAULT_ASK_PASS(/home/testuser/repos/playbooks/ansible.cfg) = True
DEFAULT_FORKS(/home/testuser/repos/playbooks/ansible.cfg) = 24

DEFAULT_TIMEOUT(/home/testuser/repos/playbooks/ansible.cfg) = 20

RETRY_FILES_SAVE_PATH(/home/testuser/repos/playbooks/ansible.cfg) = /home/testuser/retry-files
```

##### OS / ENVIRONMENT
<!--- Provide all relevant information below, e.g. target OS versions, network device firmware, etc. -->
Cisco IOS XE Software, Version 17.12.03

##### STEPS TO REPRODUCE
<!--- Describe exactly how to reproduce the problem, using a minimal test-case -->

<!--- Paste example playbooks or commands between quotes below -->
```yaml
  - name: Configure VLAN on switches
    cisco.ios.ios_vlans:
      config:

```

issueDTO.title: Native histograms: zero sample of created timestamp should have counter reset hint
issueDTO.description:
From the [Native histogram spec](https://prometheus.io/docs/specs/native_histograms/#created-timestamp-handling):

> TODO: Currently, Prometheus probably sets it to UnknownCounterReset for the first sample of a series, which is not wrong, but I think setting it to CounterReset makes more sense.

This is concerning created timestamp ingestion. The "first sample" means the zero sample representing the counter reset.

issueDTO.title: [Feature] Add Mermaid diagram & image rendering support
issueDTO.description:
### Problem Type (问题类型)

others (please edit later)

### Your Question (问题描述)

### Feature Description (功能描述)

🎯 Problem Description

**Current Situation**:

- The project uses Mermaid syntax in documentation files (e.g., content/en/docs/quickstart/hugegraph-ai/quick_start.md) but these diagrams are not being rendered properly. The Mermaid code blocks are displayed as raw text instead of rendered diagrams.

- The images in the page [quick_start](https://hugegraph.apache.org/docs/quickstart/hugegraph-ai/quick_start) can't be randering properly.

**Specific Issues**:

- 3 mermaid flowcharts in [quick_start.md](https://github.com/apache/incubator-hugegraph-doc/blob/master/content/en/docs/quickstart/hugegraph-ai/quick_start.md) cannot be rendered properly

- Project architecture diagram in [main doc](https://github.com/apache/incubator-hugegraph-doc/blob/master/content/en/docs/quickstart/hugegraph-ai/_index.md) also cannot be displayed

- Users can only see raw mermaid code, unable to understand project workflows and architecture

- Users can not see actually image which should be randered in [documentation](https://hugegraph.apache.org/docs/quickstart/hugegraph-ai/quick_start/)
comments:
<!-- Greeting -->
Hi @weijinglin! I'm [Dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot) and I’m helping the incubator-hugegraph-doc team.

<!-- Answer -->
To enable Mermaid diagram rendering in the HugeGraph documentation, add the following to your `config.toml`:

```toml
[params.mermaid]
enable = true

[markup]
  [markup.highlight]
    guessSyntax = false
```

This activates the built-in Docsy/Hugo support for Mermaid diagrams, so code blocks with `mermaid` will render as diagrams instead of raw text. The site already includes the necessary scripts and logic to load and initialize Mermaid.js when this config is present [source](https://github.com/apache/incubator-hugegraph-doc/blob/48ff6f261c634e8d8ae9c4fac9e21524f67424b5/themes/docsy/layouts/partials/scripts.html).

For image issues: make sure all images referenced in documentation are stored locally (for example, in the `static/` directory) rather than using remote URLs, which can break or be blocked [source](https://github.com/apache/incubator-hugegraph-doc/blob/48ff6f261c634e8d8ae9c4fac9e21524f67424b5/config.toml). Hosting all third-party resources (like Mermaid.js, images, fonts) locally also helps avoid CSP and privacy policy issues [source](https://github.com/apache/incubator-hugegraph-doc/issues/388).

After updating the configuration and image locations, rebuild the site and the diagrams/images should render as expected.

@dosu

refer 
- https://github.com/google/docsy/issues/1882#issue-2161794123
- https://github.com/google/docsy/pull/990

<!-- Answer -->
The Docsy bug described in google/docsy#1882 (where Mermaid rendering fails if `[params.mermaid]` is missing) does not affect HugeGraph docs as implemented. The theme logic in this repo only loads Mermaid scripts if `.Site.Params.mermaid.enable` is set, so the specific `var params = null` TypeError cannot occur here. Your Mermaid diagrams are not rendering because the required config is missing, not due to the upstream bug.

To fix Mermaid rendering, add this to your `config.toml`:

```toml
[params.mermaid]
enable = true

[markup]
  [markup.highlight]
    guessSyntax = false
```

This will enable Mermaid support and ensure diagrams render as expected. For future troubleshooting, consider tracking the Docsy theme version or commit in your repo for clarity on upstream changes and bug status.  
[Reference: scripts.html logic](https://github.com/apache/incubator-hugegraph-doc/blob/48ff6f261c634e8d8ae9c4fac9e21524f67424b5/themes/docsy/layouts/partials/scripts.html)

issueDTO.title: Crud: SelectField with dynamic options triggers option loading for every row
issueDTO.description:
**Description:**

Currently, when using `SelectField` with dynamic options (e.g., from a remote source or computed function), the component **loads options separately for each row** in list or table views. This leads to **multiple duplicate network requests** or expensive calculations, significantly degrading performance.

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Use a `SelectField` that fetches options dynamically (e.g., via API call or computed function).
2. Render a list or table with multiple rows using that field.
3. Observe that options are re-fetched for every row, even if identical.

**Expected behavior:**

* Options should be **cached or shared across rows**, not reloaded individually.
* Ideally, implement **memoization or global fetch per field config** instead of per row.

**Suggested solution:**

* Add option-level caching using key/field identity.
* Allow developers to explicitly mark dynamic options as reusable across multiple items.
* Optimize rendering for cases with common or slow-to-fetch options.

**Impact:**

* High on performance and UX in large lists.
* Causes unnecessary load on backend if fetching from API.

repository.description: IOTA-SDK - is an open-source modular ERP. An alternative to SAP, Oracle, Odoo written in Go with modern look & feel

summary.main: The issue is about the performance and UX degradation caused by reloading dynamic options for every row in list or table views, which leads to multiple duplicate network requests or expensive calculations.

summary.attemptedFixes: Add option-level caching using key/field identity, allow developers to explicitly mark dynamic options as reusable across multiple items, and optimize rendering for cases with common or slow-to-fetch options.

issueDTO.title: Make MonitorUpdatingPersister change persist type based on size
issueDTO.description:
One thing that smaller LDK clients might want is to use MonitorUpdatingPersister in many cases, but not if the ChannelMonitor is only, say, a few KiB when serialized. This avoids the overhead of compaction later if the actual monitor being persisted is tiny anyway.

I think this should be quite easy to do so tagging as a good first issue.
comments: can i work on this sir?
Sure!

>This avoids the overhead of compaction later if the actual monitor being persisted is tiny anyway.

Is this significant if the channel monitor is small anyway?

If the storage layer is remote and high latency I think it could be? I guess in theory if we're really careful about the lookup logic (and the KVStore is async) we could do the loading in parallel (though its still a few more requests) but we'd still have to wait on compaction (without a background-compaction task running, which would require a generic `spawn` method...). Seems much easier to just check the length and skip some code for the common case :)

If I understand it correctly, this is special casing for channels at the beginning of their life and when they grow, the node will switch over to persisting updates and compaction anyway?

To me it isn't quite clear if this is really worth it. If the hit is significant, it is also a problem when the channel has outgrown the 'small' stage anyway?

> If I understand it correctly, this is special casing for channels at the beginning of their life and when they grow, the node will switch over to persisting updates and compaction anyway?

Yes.

> To me it isn't quite clear if this is really worth it. If the hit is significant, it is also a problem when the channel has outgrown the 'small' stage anyway?

Its more a recognition of two very different cases - if you're running an "edge node" that is just a wallet making occasional payments, then you're likely to never hit the "large" stage, and thus avoiding the compaction overhead is a really nice optimization. If you're a larger node that is forwarding/processing many payments, you're very likely to hit the "large" stage and the compaction penalty is worth it to avoid the writes.
At what size would the "large" stage be entered then typically and how many htlcs/channel updates is that? A channel monitor of a few kb, that doesn't sound like all that many updates?

Yea, dunno, we'd have to figure that out. I imagine most mobile nodes probably make in the 100s to low 1000s of payments in their entire lifetime, probably fewer on a single channel once you consider splicing and the like. 10KiB or whatever should be plenty for 100 or 250 payments.

> Its more a recognition of two very different cases

It sounds like if you wanted to make this automatic, the metric you'd really want to evaluate to switch this behavior isn't so much monitor size, as one of these:

  - Frequency of updates to the channel
  - Latency of updates to the channel (more difficult)

The monitor size is a decent reflection of the _number_ of updates to the channel[1], but with no perception of time it's impossible to evaluate whether it's being stored by a tenured edge node, or a routing node. I think if you took time into account, perhaps by using the block delta between the funding tx and chain tip to estimate update frequency, you could make a more informed assessment.

However, I worry that automating the behavior selection is not really following the "principle of least astonishment." 

I would think that routing nodes rarely move to the edge, and edge nodes rarely become routing nodes (more often, a routing node starts small and may appear like an edge). And furthermore, I know what my node is likely to be; especially if I'm a Lightning developer and managing this on behalf of users, such as in a mobile wallet.

For that matter, varying the behavior _per channel_ seems to make node persistence more difficult to reason about. Different channels could persist different ways on my node, depending on a size threshold. Which means they can change without me doing anything. I would think that if the reason for variation is the use case, then one behavior is correct for all channels stored by the node.

In that light, I'd just leave this a configurable behavior, which I think it is now.

[1] I recognize that size is being used here to evaluate the storage write size, not the number of updates. But I think that is why the discussion is unclear. Compared to update count/frequency, it's much harder to know the storage configuration of a given node, and what the throughput/latency tradeoff is like.

I think the intent of the proposed change is to optimize for the edge-node case with remote storage. Even an edge node may make enough payments to get a monitor up to 10s of KiB in size, at which point network-level effects like TCP slowstart may dominate the actual network latency. For a "power-user" edge node, we really want to use the `MonitorUpdatingPersister`, but paying the extra RTT cost of cleanup on load for every edge node is not a great tradeoff either.

For a routing node, it still seems to me like a size-based threshold may be something they want, purely as it (very marginally) reduces IO throughput for under-utilized or new channels. Writing out updates (padded to 4KiB or more depending on the storage medium) and then consolidating when the whole monitor is only a few KiB isn't really the right tradeoff no matter what. Of course a routing node is expected to surpass the threshold very quickly, so it shouldn't really make a substantial difference, but it seems strictly better to write out full updates in this case than not.

Indeed, this does lead to a bit of behavior shift, but I think the important metrics wouldn't change - first of all, if you happened to look at storage right after compaction, the stored contents would be identical to a full monitor persistence so I wouldn't really say that this materially changes the way that logic would interact with the stored data (you already have to handle the case of having no in-flight updates!). It also shouldn't materially change the IO throughput or write count for any node, just a fairly marginal strict reduction for routing nodes with fresh channels.

> At what size would the "large" stage be entered then typically and how many htlcs/channel updates is that? A channel monitor of a few kb, that doesn't sound like all that many updates?

For our probing node running ldk-node with network storage (EFS), at around 20,000 updates over the single channel the average probe duration starts to increase substantially. p75 starts to creep up after about 3,000.
Do y'all have any further thoughts here, @domZippilli or @amackillop?

> Do y'all have any further thoughts here, [@domZippilli](https://github.com/domZippilli) or [@amackillop](https://github.com/amackillop)?

I see in the PR it's configurable. I think as long as that's the case, developers who don't want the variation in behavior can set the minimum size to `0`.

eta: Also, I'm still not sure I like that it varies across channels, rather than a consistent behavior on a node.
Perhaps wait for developers who do want/need the variation in behavior to show up and only then implement? I think the "principle of least astonishment" is worth considering.

> Perhaps wait for developers who do want/need the variation in behavior to show up and only then implement? I think the "principle of least astonishment" is worth considering.

Well, we likely do want to enable MUP in LDK Node, especially when persisting vs. remote storage/VSS. The question is whether it's preferable to *always* use MUP, even for very small monitors. I'd be reluctant to expose a setting in LDK Node for this, as I don't think our users would have better insight into which way to go than we do.

> Perhaps wait for developers who do want/need the variation in behavior to show up and only then implement? I think the "principle of least astonishment" is worth considering.

FWIW I think the "principle of least astonishment" is served perfectly fine by changing the MUP to persist full monitors when they're small - there's no material difference in user-visible behavior between persisting full monitors and small ones, except the performance changes (i.e. we definitely can't persist full monitors that are huge). When persisting small monitors, its no difference from hitting the cleanup ID where we delete the updates anyway. Because of this I still think this change is *strictly better* than the current version.

>there's no material difference in user-visible behavior between persisting full monitors and small ones

That's clear. I was thinking of least astonishment in reasoning about and resolving potential problems. Basically what @domZippilli mentions in https://github.com/lightningdevkit/rust-lightning/issues/3770#issuecomment-2984271612.

In this case, I would define 'strictly better' as a performance increase without an increase in complexity.

summary.main: The main goal is to optimize the MonitorUpdatingPersister to avoid compaction overhead for small ChannelMonitors. The idea is to make it configurable based on the size of the ChannelMonitor, allowing edge nodes with remote storage to avoid the overhead.

summary.attemptedFixes: The proposed change is to make the MonitorUpdatingPersister change persist type based on size. The idea is to optimize for edge nodes with remote storage by avoiding compaction overhead for small ChannelMonitors.

The idea is to make it configurable based on the size of the ChannelMonitor. The discussion revolves around the threshold size and whether it's worth optimizing for edge nodes with remote storage.

issueDTO.title: [layouts] Brand new layout item rotation handles (Request in QGIS)
issueDTO.description:
### Request for documentation
From pull request qgis/QGIS#61883
Author: @nirvn
QGIS version: 4.0

**[layouts] Brand new layout item rotation handles**

### PR Description:
## Description

This PR implements rotation handles UI/UX for selected layout item(s), allowing for users to tweak item rotation to perfect their layouts straight within the layout designer sheet.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/185b35be-1274-4bad-922b-ab2a02b8341e

The implementation comes with a Control modifier allows the rotation to snap to 15 degree angles, and supports rotation of multiple selected items (sharing a common rotation center point).

The functionality was added to the QgsGraphicsViewMouseHandles, which means it can be re-used beyond the layout designer itself (rotated modeler parameter boxes? :wink:).




### Commits tagged with [need-docs] or [FEATURE]

Vite

### Where do you see the problem?

- [x] In the terminal

### Describe the bug

The most recent updates to CRXJS use the new bright colour options from `picocolors`, but the [version specified](https://github.com/crxjs/chrome-extension-tools/blob/2a629cfe962c9a1deb2626193151498ad782bed6/packages/vite-plugin/package.json#L79) in `package.json` (`^1.0.0`) doesn't have these new bright colour variants. 

This causes the Vite plugin to fail on startup.

Please up the version to `^1.1.0` to make this go away 😄

N/A - private repo

comments:
@nt4f04uNd 

On latest master, I see the same error log as you posted:
```

======== Exception caught by rendering library =====================================================
The following assertion was thrown during paint():
'package:flutter/src/painting/border_radius.dart': Failed assertion: line 727 pos 12: 'direction != null': is not true.


Either the assertion indicates an error in the framework itself, or we should provide substantially more information in this error message to help you determine and fix the underlying cause.
In either case, please report this assertion by filing a bug on GitHub:
  https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new?template=2_bug.md

```

On latest stable though, it seems to be a bit better ?
```

======== Exception caught by rendering library =====================================================
The following _CastError was thrown during paint():
type 'BorderRadiusDirectional' is not a subtype of type 'BorderRadius?' in type cast

The relevant error-causing widget was: 
  Container file:///Users/dhs/Documents/NCFlutter/bug_test/lib/main.dart:4:10
When the exception was thrown, this was the stack: 
#0      _BoxDecorationPainter.paint (package:flutter/src/painting/box_decoration.dart:488:46)
#1      RenderDecoratedBox.paint (package:flutter/src/rendering/proxy_box.dart:2143:17)
#2      RenderObject._paintWithContext (package:flutter/src/rendering/object.dart:2317:7)
#3      PaintingContext.paintChild (package:flutter/src/rendering/object.dart:187:13)
#4      RenderView.paint (package:flutter/src/rendering/view.dart:200:15)
```

`type 'BorderRadiusDirectional' is not a subtype of type 'BorderRadius?' in type cast` which seems to give an indication what's wrong with the implementation and hence the error.
It is a fixed crash, see https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/88039. On stable it wouldn't resolve even if you wrapped the container with the `Directionality`.
This issue is missing a priority label. Please set a priority label when adding the `triaged-design` label.

    - data:
        answer: 'status: {{#1750841632262.status_code#}}

          body:


          {{#1750841632262.body#}}'
        desc: ''
        selected: false

        type: answer

      height: 140

        x: 680

        x: 680

      selected: false
      sourcePosition: right
      targetPosition: left
      type: custom
      width: 244
    viewport:
      x: 150
      y: 110
      zoom: 1
```

</details>


### ✔️ Expected Behavior

The execution succeeds.

### ❌ Actual Behavior

The execution fails with the following message:

> Run failed: Illegal header value b'Basic '

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9e7d06ed-ccc3-4437-90af-ec6d6181041f)
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This failure happens because the HTTPRequest node always constructs an `Authorization` header for "Basic" or "Bearer" auth types, even if the API key is empty. When the API key is empty, the header becomes `Authorization: Basic ` or `Authorization: Bearer `, which is considered an illegal header value by the HTTP library and causes the execution to fail ([source](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/bb955806e042517831b232948c3f9f7150ac5fb6/api/core/workflow/nodes/http_request/executor.py)). The code only checks that the API key field exists, not that it contains a non-empty value.

As a workaround, avoid configuring HTTPRequest nodes with empty API keys for these auth types. If your workflow might have an empty key, consider adding logic to skip the HTTPRequest node or switch to "no-auth" when the key is empty. There’s currently no built-in validation or warning for this in Dify, so it’s a systemic issue, not a new regression.

No official documentation or existing issues address this yet. It would be helpful for the platform to add validation or user warnings for empty API keys in future releases.


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To reply, just mention [@dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot).*

---
<sup>How did I do? [Good](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=great_response) | [Irrelevant](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=irrelevant_answer) | [Incorrect](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=incorrect_sources) | [Verbose](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=too_verbose) | [Hallucination](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=hallucination) | [Report 🐛](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=bug_report) | [Other](https://app.dosu.dev/response-feedback/55f0e8f8-1c51-4938-b035-9714f0832b7b?feedback_type=other)</sup>  [![Join Discord](https://img.shields.io/badge/join-5865F2?logo=discord&logoColor=white&label=)](https://go.dosu.dev/discord-bot) [![Share on X](https://img.shields.io/badge/X-share-black)](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=%40dosu_ai%20helped%20me%20solve%20this%20issue!&url=https%3A//github.com/langgenius/dify/issues/21830)

The root cause of this bug is that [httpx does not allow header values with trailing spaces](https://github.com/encode/httpx/discussions/1641). The correspond code is [here](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/bb955806e042517831b232948c3f9f7150ac5fb6/api/core/workflow/nodes/http_request/executor.py#L267) and [here](https://github.com/langgenius/dify/blob/bb955806e042517831b232948c3f9f7150ac5fb6/api/core/workflow/nodes/http_request/executor.py#L274)

issueDTO.title: Some environment variables documented in the CLI docs are missing in node manpage
issueDTO.description:
### Version

24

### Platform

```text
All
```

### Subsystem

doc

### What steps will reproduce the bug?

Run `man node` and view the `ENVIRONMENT` section

Compare it to https://nodejs.org/api/cli.html#environment-variables_1 ([permalink](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/8b199eef3dd4de910a6521adc42ae611a62a19e1/doc/api/cli.md?plain=1#L3204))

### How often does it reproduce? Is there a required condition?

Always

### What is the expected behavior? Why is that the expected behavior?

Whatever is documented in the CLI documentation should also be documented in the node manpage

### What do you see instead?

The following environment variables are missing:
 - `NODE_COMPILE_CACHE`
 - `NODE_DISABLE_COMPILE_CACHE`
 - `NODE_PENDING_PIPE_INSTANCES`
 - `NODE_TEST_CONTEXT`
 - `NODE_USE_ENV_PROXY`

### Additional information

They need to be added in the [appropriate node.1 section](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/8b199eef3dd4de910a6521adc42ae611a62a19e1/doc/node.1#L674).

Afterwords the following code, since no longer necessary, needs to be removed: https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/4b4aaf921fda21c329caf349b23c0620867e4e6c/test/parallel/test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars.mjs#L24-L32
comments: hi i try to fix it, this is my first time fixing issues in open source projects

@HumaneLogic Great! It's nice to have you here, welcome to the project 😄 

If you need any help just let me know 🙂

@dario-piotrowicz thank you very much, i'm very excited , i have some questions
i added the missing environment variables and removed lines in test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars
now i should git add . and git commit -m "" (with a proper message of course) 
or 
git add doc\node.1 test\parallel\test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars.mjs and git commit -m ""  ?
 then just do git push?  or git push origin my-branch-name?
should i build the project?
 also is there a way i can see the results in mappage locally to see if they are accurate?
is this message good "doc: add missing environment variables to manpage and remove test workaround"?
sorry for so many questions

> [@dario-piotrowicz](https://github.com/dario-piotrowicz) thank you , i have questions

👋 

> i added the missing environment variables and removed lines in test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars now i should git add . and git commit -m "" (with a proper message of course) or git add doc\node.1 test\parallel\test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars.mjs and git commit -m "" ? then just do git push? or git push origin my-branch-name? should i build the project? also is there a way i can see the results in mappage locally to see if they are accurate? is this message good "doc: add missing environment variables to manpage and remove test workaround"? sorry for so many questions

Regarding git, yes run `git add doc\node.1 test\parallel\test-cli-node-cli-manpage-env-vars.mjs` (or simply `git add .` from the root of the repository) and then the commit, message, try to be concise since there's a character limit to it `git commit -m '"doc: add missing environment variables to manpage"` looks good to me 🙂 

Then you can simply run `git push`, although it'd be more convenient to you if you used a branch different from `main` (before running the previously mentioned git commands)

> should i build the project?

You don't necessarily need to build the project for this issue, if you want you can do that to make sure the test works as intended but if you don't the CI checks run on the PR will also validate that the test passes

How you build the project depends on your platform, you can find guidance about that and how to run tests here: https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/main/BUILDING.md

(but again you can skip that for this issue)

> sorry for so many questions

No worries 🙂
@dario-piotrowicz thank you, i created a PR #58924

> @dario-piotrowicz thank you, i created a PR #58924 

Fantastic, I'll review it tomorrow 😀 

By the way I forgot to reply to your question about making sure that it works as intended...

You can run `man -l doc/node.1` to view your locally updated manpage on Linux/MacOS (or under WSL in windows)
@dario-piotrowicz thanks

issueDTO.title: Update Project Profile: Website- Remove Daniel Franco

### Prerequisites
1. Be a member of Hack for LA. (There are no fees to join.) If you have not joined yet, please follow the steps on our [Getting Started](https://www.hackforla.org/getting-started) page and attend an onboarding session.
2. You have already read our [How to Contribute to Hack for LA Guide](https://github.com/hackforla/website/blob/gh-pages/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Overview
We need to keep project information up to date so that visitors to the website can find accurate information.

### Action Items
- [x] In your IDE, open the `_projects/website.md` file.
- [x] Observe the existing syntax of the front matter block [^1] in the file.
- [x]  Find the `leadership` variable and remove the following:
  ```
  - name: Daniel Franco
    github-handle: FamousHero
    role: Merge Team
    links:
      slack: https://hackforla.slack.com/team/U076AV5ALPP
      github: https://github.com/FamousHero
    picture: https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/FamousHero
  ```
- [x] Verify the changes by viewing the following in your local environment and include before and after screenshots with your pull request:
  - [x] Website project page [^2]

### Resources/Instructions
[^1]: [Info about the front matter block](https://jekyllrb.com/docs/front-matter/)
[^2]: Project detailed info page URL: https://www.hackforla.org/projects/website
